**Sista ansökningdag:** 16-02-2026 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Senior Full stack Developer (Java)
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*

 **Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

We are looking for a consultant with advanced expertise in both backend and frontend development, particularly with a strong background in Java. The ideal profile includes a track record of designing scalable, high-performance systems and hands-on experience with both relational and non-relational databases, such as MongoDB. Proficiency in Angular, Typescript, UX/UI design, CI/CD pipelines, Kubernetes, Azure Cloud Services, and messaging platforms like Kafka and MQ is must. Familiarity with agile methodologies is essential.  

  

**Application deadline:** 17-02-2026

 **About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Embedded Software Developer- Automotive
description:
We are looking for a **Senior Embedded Developer- Automotive** for a global automotive company in **Gothenburg.**

**Start is in ASAP, 10 months limited contract to begin with, Possibility of extension after that.**

**Competence profile:**

* Masters in electrical/electronics engineering/ software engineering (Embedded Systems & SW development), or equivalent
* At least 5 years experience with C programming (90 or 99)
* At least 5 years experience in real time embedded system development
* Experience from Automotive industry
* Having experience working with Autosar
* Having knowledge of Automotive communication protocol: Can, Automotive Ethernet
* Having knowledge of UDS(Unified Diagnostic Service)
* Have experience working with Vector tool: CANOE, CANalyzer, VTEST
* Have knowledge on low level protocol firmware development: SPI, UART, PWM, DIO, PSI5
* HIL systems and real-time simulation
* Having knowledge of System Safety Implementation compliant with ISO26262
* Familiarity with cyber security standards in Automotive
* Ability to work in multi-cultural environment
* Good at initiating communication when needed
* **Fluency in English**

**What you will do:**

* Working in a in-house software team that develops software for Suspension system in both Suspension ECU and Central ECU of the vehicle.
* You will work closely with other developers, test engineers, system engineers, safety engineers and may take cross-function tasks depends on the need of the project.
* Your main responsibility is to develop application software in C++ and middle ware in C.

**Nice to have:**

* If you can share with us side projects, or open source software that you have contributed to.
* Suspension knowledge
* Having experience working with Agile software development method
* Experience in C++ (11 or 14)

**Do you fit the profile?**


For you to fully enjoy this opportunity, we believe that you are a motivated and self-driven software developer that would like to take initiative to improve our product. You embrace teamwork, collaboration and are eager to learn and develop new competences. Experience from working in the automotive industry especially in the vehicle dynamics arena is a clear advantage to succeed in this role.

  

This is a full-time consultant position in **Gothenburg** through Incluso. Start is **ASAP, 10 months** limited contract to begin with, with possibility of extension after that.  

  

Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact **Kanika Singhal** recruiter at Incluso.

title: Mjukvaruutvecklare
description:
##### **Om tjänsten**


Vi söker nu en erfaren mjukvaruutvecklare som vill arbeta med teknik i framkant på vår kunds kontor i Göteborg. Vår samarbetspartner är ett ledande produktbolag inom försvarsindustrin, verksamt inom många tekniska områden för människors trygghet i samhället.


Arbetet omfattar utveckling av simulerade radarmiljöer, videogränssnitt och scenarion som möjliggör test och verifiering av system innan de körs mot verklig hårdvara. Simulatorerna är en central del i utvecklingen av nästa generations produkter och används genom hela utvecklingskedjan.


Arbetet är systemnära och sker i Linuxbaserade realtidssystem. Miljön omfattar även HPC-lösningar och HIL-simuleringar kopplade till sensor- och kommunikationssystem. C++ är det huvudsakliga språket i utvecklingen, medan Python och Java används i kompletterande delar av lösningen.


Du blir en del av ett självständigt Scrum-team med blandad erfarenhetsnivå. Teamet präglas av ansvarstagande, samarbete och en vilja att utvecklas tillsammans. Här finns utrymme att bidra både tekniskt och i hur arbetssätt och lösningar utvecklas över tid.

##### **Din kompetens**


För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:


* Flera års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling
* Mycket goda kunskaper i C++ och erfarenhet av Python samt Java
* Erfarenhet av realtidssystem på Linux
* Erfarenhet av HIL-simulering och modellering kopplat till sensor- eller kommunikationssystem


Erfarenhet av DevOps-relaterade områden såsom CI/CD, Jenkins, Git, containerlösningar och scripting i Python eller Bash är meriterande. Det är även positivt med erfarenhet av testning på olika nivåer samt arbete i verktyg som Jira och Confluence.


Som person är du trygg i din kompetens, tar ansvar för ditt arbete och har förmåga att driva utveckling framåt tillsammans med andra. Du har ett tekniskt intresse, är nyfiken och trivs i miljöer där komplexa system och långsiktig produktutveckling står i fokus.

##### **Övrigt**


Lön: Fast månadslön


Omfattning: Heltid, tillsvidare


Start: Omgående med hänsyn tagen till din eventuella uppsägningstid


Placeringsort: Göteborg


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. Denna tjänst innebär krav på svenskt medborgarskap.


Vi behandlar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden har gått ut, skicka din ansökan redan idag!

##### **Om oss**


Procruitment är Sveriges enda karriärbyrå inom IT, tech och engineering som genom proaktiv rekrytering förenar attraktiva arbetsgivare med människor som delar samma mål och ambitioner. Oavsett om du är en erfaren ledare eller om du ska ta ditt första steg ut i karriären hjälper vi dig att nå dina karriärmål - samtidigt som vi bryr oss om dig, din resa och att du mår bra längs vägen.  

  

Procruitment är stolta vinnare av Recruitment Awards och är utsedda till ***Årets Rekryteringsföretag*** och ***Årets Raket***samt ***Gasellföretag 2024*** *av* Dagens Industri*.*

title: Senior Javautvecklare
description:
**Syntronic söker en senior javautvecklare till spännande uppdrag hos kund!**


Vi söker en senior Javautvecklare med gedigen erfarenhet som vill arbeta med moderna tekniker och vara med och utveckla avancerade, skalbara lösningar i kunduppdrag. I rollen arbetar du med bland annat AWS och microservice-arkitektur för att designa, bygga och vidareutveckla robusta tjänster.


Du tar stort eget ansvar och arbetar nära andra utvecklare i teambaserade leveranser där du bidrar genom hela tjänstens livscykel. Rollen omfattar allt från kravanalys och systemdesign till utveckling, test, driftsättning och förvaltning, med ett kontinuerligt fokus på förbättringar, kvalitet och innovation.

**Vi söker dig som:**

* Har en högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen inom t.ex. Datavetenskap, Teknik, Matematik, Mjukvaruutveckling eller motsvarande
* Har minst 5 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom systemutveckling
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt, exempelvis SAFe eller Scrum
* Gedigen erfarenhet av microservice-baserade system
* Djupa kunskaper i Java, Linux, Spring Boot, Maven eller enhetstestning med exempelvis JUnit
* Erfarenhet av AWS-tjänster, bland annat CloudFormation, Identity and Access Management (IAM), EC2, ECS, Lambda eller API Gateway
* Erfarenhet av databaser som DynamoDB och/eller Aurora PostgreSQL
* Har förmåga att kommunicera flytande på både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.

**Meriterande kompetenser:**

* Kunskap inom IT- och applikationssäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av certifikathantering och bästa praxis för certifikatens livscykel
* Arbete med både relationsdatabaser och NoSQL-databaser
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD och kontinuerlig integration i microservice-miljöer

**Personliga egenskaper**


Är en kreativ och flexibel problemlösare som är öppen för att testa nya arbetssätt och trivs med att arbeta brett genom hela mjukvaruprocessen. Vi ser att du är nyfiken och dynamisk i din roll, gillar att utforska nya lösningar självständigt och trivs i samarbete med andra. Du har ett inkluderande arbetssätt och bidrar till en positiv och öppen teamkultur.


Syntronic erbjuder en trygg anställning i en dynamisk och framåtriktad miljö. Att vi är ett team är vår styrka, därför ser vi att du arbetar tillsammans på plats med oss på kontoret – när du inte behövs hos någon av våra kunder förstås!

**Vi erbjuder**


På Syntronic blir du en del av en härlig gemenskap där din röst hörs och dina idéer välkomnas. Vi erbjuder flexibla arbetstider, balans mellan arbete och fritid samt regelbundna karriärutvecklingssamtal och interna workshops för din utveckling. Utöver detta får du förmånliga förmåner och försäkringar. Hos oss får du inte bara ett jobb – du får en plats att växa och trivas både personligt och professionellt.

**Ansökan**


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan, som ska vara oss tillhanda senast 10 mars. Vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.


Bakgrundskontroller kan förekomma.


Av kommunikation- och kvalitetssäkringsskäl ber vi dig att skicka in din ansökan digitalt via vårt system och inte via e-post.
company_description: Are you ready to be a part of a global engineering design house that is pushing the boundaries within product development? https://www.syntronic.com/vacancies/

title: Full Stack Developer- Motion Control
description:
We are looking for **3** **Fullstack Developer- Motion Control** for a global manufacturing company in **Västerås.**

**Start is in March 2026, 12 months limited contract to begin with, Possibility of extension after that.**

**We are looking for** **three consultants to join R&D Advanced Mechatronics and Motion Control department.**

**Two positions require proficiency in programming languages such as C/C++, MATLAB, or Python.**

**One position is aimed at a more senior profile working as a Full Stack Developer in a C# .NET environment.**


We are open to considering both junior and senior engineers depending on overall competence and experience.

**Role Overview**


As a Motion Control Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, optimizing, and maintaining software solutions within the motion control domain. You will work in a highly technical R&D environment focusing on advanced mechatronics systems and motion technologies.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Develop and optimize motion control software solutions
* Work with advanced mechatronics and control systems
* Contribute to system design, testing, and performance improvements
* Collaborate with cross-functional R&D teams

**Required Qualifications**

* Master’s degree in Robotics, Mechatronics, Computer Science, Engineering Physics, Control Engineering, or a related field
* Experience with real-time operating systems and embedded systems
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
* Excellent communication and teamwork abilities
* **Fluency in English, both written and spoken (mandatory)**
* **Swedish language skills are considered an advantage**


This is a full-time consultant position in **Västerås** through Incluso. Start is **in March 2026, 12 months** limited contract to begin with, with possibility of extension after that.  

  

Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact **Kanika Singhal** recruiter at Incluso.

title: Senior Backendutvecklare – C# / .NET
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Vana vid att arbeta med avancerad affärslogik och systemlogik
* Stark kompetens inom backendutveckling
* God insikt i distribuerade system samt hur stabila och motståndskraftiga backendlösningar byggs
* Flera års arbete med C# och .NET på senior nivå

  

**Meriterande**  

Erfarenhet av NATS eller andra liknande lösningar för message bus eller meddelandehantering. Det anses även som meriterande om du har arbetat med system som ställer höga krav på tillgänglighet, återställning och driftsäkerhet.  

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 12-02-2026  

  

**Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: ServiceNow utvecklare
description:
**Om rollen**


Som ServiceNow-utvecklare blir du en del av vårt ServiceNow & Configuration-team i Stockholm, bestående av utvecklare, lösningsarkitekt och processpecialister. Teamets uppdrag är att säkerställa en stabil, säker och långsiktigt hållbar ServiceNow-plattform.


Du arbetar verksamhetsnära med att förstå behov och omsätta dem till väl genomtänkta lösningar enligt ServiceNows best practices. Rollen spänner över både utveckling och förvaltning och ger dig möjlighet att påverka hur plattformen används och utvecklas över tid.


Eftersom teamet är relativt litet får du en bred roll och insyn i flera delar av Skandia – från IT och säkerhet till HR, juridik och inköp.


Vi arbetar i en hybrid arbetsmodell och du rapporterar till gruppchef IT Process & Leveransstöd.

 **Du kommer bland annat att:**

* Utveckla och konfigurera funktionalitet i ServiceNow
* Förvalta och vidareutveckla plattformen i takt med nya behov
* Arbeta med integrationer och API:er för stabila och effektiva flöden
* Hantera felsökning, incidenter och löpande förvaltningsarbete
* Samarbeta tätt med verksamhet, arkitekter och tekniska team
* Bidra till kvalitet, struktur och långsiktig utveckling av plattformen
 **För att lyckas i rollen söker vi dig som:**

* Har mångårig erfarenhet av ServiceNow-utveckling och plattformsförvaltning
* Är trygg i att arbeta nära verksamheten och omsätta behov till tekniska lösningar
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift
* Trivs i ett mindre team med stort eget ansvar
 **Du har erfarenhet av:**

* ServiceNow ITSM
* CMDB och Discovery
* Design och förvaltning av API-integrationer
* Förvaltning och vidareutveckling av ServiceNow-plattformen
 **Vem är du?**


Du är målmedveten, engagerad och noggrann i ditt arbete, med ett analytiskt förhållningssätt till problemlösning. Du är kommunikativ och samarbetar väl både självständigt och tillsammans med andra. Du tar ansvar, delar med dig av din kunskap och bidrar till att stötta kollegor, samtidigt som du har ett genuint intresse för att skapa stabila och hållbara lösningar.

 **Vad händer nu?**


Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.  

  

Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef **Anders Björnemalm** på anders.bjornemalm@skandia.se.

  

  

Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocessen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner **Nina Fazeli** på nina.fazeli@skandia.se

  




  

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

**Mer om IT**


Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!


Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.


Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Developer
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*

**Om tjänsten**
---------------


Fortnox fortsätter att växa och i Linköping bygger vi nu vidare på en snabbt växande utvecklingshubb med flera team inom Fortnox-familjen. Här utvecklar vi nästa generations finansiella system som gör livet enklare för Sveriges företagare.


Som utvecklare hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i ett tvärfunktionellt team med helhetsansvar - från idé till lansering. Du får arbeta produktnära, agilt och med stort fokus på kundvärde, där vi tillsammans skapar skalbara, säkra och användarvänliga FinTech-tjänster.


Hos oss bygger vi hela funktioner “från ax till limpa”: databearbetning, dataanalys och backend och frontend - allt för att skapa lösningar som förändrar hur svenska företag hanterar sina finanser.

**Vi arbetar med**
------------------

**Backend:** Kotlin, Java  

**Frontend:** TypeScript, React  

**Integration & data:** REST-API:er, SQL-databaser, Kafka  

**Övrigt:** Microservices, GitHub/Bitbucket

**Om dig**
----------


Vi söker dig som har ett genuint teknikintresse, gillar att ta ansvar och trivs i en miljö där innovation och samarbete står i centrum. Du är nyfiken, självgående och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap till andra.


Vi tror att du har:

* Stark kompetens inom backend och gärna även frontend (React/TypeScript)
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt och produktnära utveckling
* Goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift

**Vad du får hos oss**
----------------------


På Fortnox bygger varje team sin egen kultur och sitt eget ramverk. Vi tror på liv i balans, och därför finns konceptet Fortnox MåBra för ditt välmående och återhämtning. Vi har ett attraktivt läge och utformning av vårt kontor på Platensgatan 8 i Linköping.


Hos oss får du inte bara en plats i ett av Sveriges mest spännande FinTech-bolag - du blir del av något större:

* En kultur där lärande och utveckling står i centrum
* Kollegor som bryr sig - om produkten, våra användare och varandra


En arbetsplats där teknik, samhällsnytta och entreprenörskap går hand i hand

**Fortnox - mitt i företagslivet**  

*Fortnox hjälper företag att starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska lösningar för företag och redovisningsbyråer, smidig finansiering och ett ekosystem av starka partnerskap är Fortnox ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vi drivs av visionen om ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag.*


\_Fortnox grundades 2001 med huvudkontor i Växjö. Läs mer på www.fortnoxgroup.com.  

\_

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

**Bra att veta**
----------------

**Arbetsort:** Linköping

**Fortnox - mitt i företagslivet**

**Bra att veta**
----------------

title: Ruby on Rails fullstackutvecklare
description:
**Ruby on Rails‑utvecklare**  

**Stockholm, Göteborg & Malmö | Nexer Maverick**

**Om rollen**  

Maverick söker en erfaren Ruby on Rails‑utvecklare med tydlig fullstackprofil och stark känsla för moderna frontend‑gränssnitt. Du kommer att arbeta i konsultuppdrag hos våra kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor, där du bygger skalbara digitala lösningar från idé till implementation. Rollen innebär att du utvecklar, förbättrar och optimerar allt från befintliga system till helt nya produkter. Du arbetar nära kunder och kollegor i tvärfunktionella team där din förmåga att samarbeta, kommunicera och omsätta behov till tekniska lösningar är lika viktig som din kodkompetens.

**Arbetsuppgifter**  

Som Ruby on Rails‑utvecklare hos Maverick arbetar du i varierade uppdrag, både på plats hos kund och i interna projekt. Du kommer att utveckla och vidareutveckla tjänster för verksamheter inom exempelvis fintech, e‑handel, industri, transport, energi och offentlig sektor.


Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar att utveckla och underhålla Rails‑applikationer, skapa moderna och responsiva frontend‑gränssnitt, designa API:er, optimera prestanda samt säkerställa robusta och säkra lösningar. Du arbetar i team tillsammans med designers, strategier och andra utvecklare – men är också bekväm med att ta ansvar självständigt.


Arbetet sker främst hybrid eller på distans, men vissa uppdrag kan kräva närvaro hos kund.

**Vi söker dig som**  

Vi letar efter dig som är nyfiken, prestigelös och trygg i din tekniska kompetens. Du trivs med att arbeta nära både kund och team, och du har lätt för att kommunicera lösningar, utmaningar och möjligheter. Du har ett öga för kvalitet, gillar moderna ramverk och är van vid agila arbetssätt.

* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av Ruby on Rails‑utveckling
* Är trygg i fullstack‑rollen och har god erfarenhet av modern frontend (t.ex. JavaScript, SCSS, Stimulus, Turbo eller liknande)
* Har erfarenhet av databaser som PostgreSQL och tekniker som Redis, ElasticSearch eller liknande
* Är van att arbeta med CI/CD, testning och versionshantering
* Har jobbat i agila team och känner dig bekväm i konsultrollen
* Kommunicerar tydligt på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


Meriterande:

* Erfarenhet av molnmiljöer som AWS, Azure eller GCP
* Erfarenhet av Next.js, TypeScript eller modern komponentbaserad frontend
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i större, komplexa kodbaser
* Intresse för prestandaoptimering, säkerhet och arkitekturfrågor

**Vi erbjuder**  

Maverick är Nexers fullservicebyrå inom digitala tjänster – en kommunikationspartner för innovativa företag, samhällsbärande myndigheter och utmanande aktörer. Med en kombination av strategi, kreativitet och digital teknik tar vi organisationer till nya nivåer. Våra tech‑team består av utvecklare, arkitekter och kreatörer som tillsammans skapar lösningar som gör skillnad.


Vi erbjuder:

* En kreativ och dynamisk miljö där du får växa både tekniskt och personligt
* Möjlighet till utbildning, certifieringar och teknisk utveckling inom moderna ramverk
* En stark gemenskap med erfarna och engagerade kollegor
* En kultur som uppmuntrar innovation, initiativ och ansvar
* Bra förmåner och ett riktigt kollektivavtal i ett privatägt bolag som sätter människan först

**Ansökan**  

Om du är en nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och engagerad utvecklare som vill skapa moderna och hållbara digitala tjänster tillsammans med ett härligt gäng – då kan detta vara din nästa roll. Sök nu.


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag.

title: Senior Backendutvecklare till Handlarfinans
description:
Handlarfinans, ett helägt dotterbolag till Svea Bank, söker en senior backendutvecklare som vill vara med och vidareutveckla vårt affärskritiska kärnsystem. Hos oss får du en central roll i den tekniska organisationen och arbetar nära både produkt och verksamhet med fokus på stabila, säkra och skalbara lösningar.

**Om rollen**  

Du blir en del av ett litet, erfaret team med stort eget ansvar och hög teknisk kompetens. Rollen innebär inget formellt personalansvar, men ett tydligt tekniskt ledarskap i det dagliga arbetet. Du arbetar hands-on med backendutveckling och är aktivt med och påverkar arkitektur, tekniska vägval och hur vi arbetar tillsammans.


Vår plattform är en modern, molnbaserad SaaS-lösning anpassad för flera marknader och med höga krav på säkerhet, tillgänglighet och datakvalitet. Vi prioriterar långsiktig kvalitet och stabilitet framför snabba kompromisser.

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**

* Backendutveckling i Python och SQL
* Utveckling och förvaltning av affärskritiska API:er
* Arbete med meddelandeinfrastruktur och systemintegrationer
* Bidra till arkitektur, kodstandarder och hög teknisk kvalitet
* Säkerställa hög säkerhet, stabil drift och god skalbarhet
* Samverka med andra team och bolag inom Svea-koncernen

**Vem är du?**  

Du har flera års erfarenhet av backendutveckling i affärskritiska system och trivs i en roll där du tar stort eget ansvar. Du är initiativtagande, lösningsorienterad och van att ta tekniskt ägarskap – både för kod, arkitektur och arbetssätt. Även om rollen inte är en chefsroll ser vi att du naturligt bidrar med ledarskap och stöd i teamet.


Vi ser gärna att du har:

* Mycket goda kunskaper i Python och SQL
* Stark förståelse för backendarkitektur och API-design
* Erfarenhet av meddelandeinfrastruktur och systemintegrationer
* Gärna erfarenhet av AWS eller annan molnplattform
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt, gärna Scrum, samt verktyg som Jira
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsnära utveckling (t.ex. autentisering och behörighet)


Du har Universitetsutbildning inom systemvetenskap eller motsvarande samt tidigare arbetat inom bank, fintech eller annan reglerad bransch. För att lyckas i denna tjänst har också goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska. Arbete från kontoret i Solna sker minst tre dagar i veckan.

**Om Handlarfinans (dotterbolag till Svea Bank)**


Handlarfinans är ett fintech-bolag som specialiserar sig på finansiella tjänster för bilhandlare i hela Norden. Vi digitaliserar och förenklar processen för lagerfinansiering och inköp av begagnade fordon och är en del av Svea Bank-koncernen.

**Ansökan**


Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterare Ellen Hallengren på ellen.hallengren@svea.com.


Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Game developer
description:
We are now looking for the best game developer to join us! You have the chance to be a part of creating the best casino games in the online slot industry!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and maintain Casino Games for both desktop and mobile browsers
* The technologies you primarily will work with are HTML5, WebGL, Typescript, Pixi, GSAP and Javascript.
* In a team environment that consists of product management, graphic artistry, sound creation, server development and game mechanics, you will contribute to deliver the best casino games in the market today.
* Your main responsibilities are to make the game graphics come alive with spectacular animations, game flow, game mechanics and sounds according to a result delivered by our game servers.


 Who you are
   

  

* You are a Master Google Searcher that have Stackoverflow as your absolute favourite web site.
* You have practical experience of working with OOP in some language and you have a pragmatic approach to software development.
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in.
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you.
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and take ownership of changes from editor to production system.


 Beneficial skills
   

  

* Working experience of mobile browsers and knowledge about their limitations and how they work in different ways is a big plus.


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Java Developer - Shape the Future of Corporate Payments | SEB Kort, Solna
description:
SEB Kort is looking for an experienced, technically strong, and driven Java developer. You are passionate about building robust, secure, and scalable systems and thrive on solving complex technical challenges as well as sharing your knowledge with others. Joining our dynamic international team, you will play a key role in our mission to be the market leader for corporate payments in Europe.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Java developer, you will be part of a cross-functional international agile team, building and maintaining scalable and secure solutions that support our wide range of card and payment products. You will plan, design, develop, test, and maintain applications together with your agile team.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* API and Java application design application and development
* Designing and building microservices
* Ensuring high standards in code quality, testing, documentation, and system performance
* Taking an active role in sharing your knowledge and contributing to improving customer experience


**Who You Are**
 We believe you are an experienced developer who combines strong technical skills with excellent communication ability. You are a problem-solver, team player, and systems thinker who takes initiative and contributes to the bigger picture, always with the customer in mind.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
* A completed degree in Computer Science or a comparable qualification
* Several years of hands-on experience in software development, specifically with Java
* Excellent knowledge of Spring Boot microservices
* Experience with service buses/streaming platforms (particularly Kafka)
* Conceptual and analytical skills as well as quick comprehension and a goal-oriented way of working
* Practical experience with DevOps and agile methodologies is a must
* Knowledge of Vue.js, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS
* Knowledge of database technologies is beneficial
* Fluency in English


**What We Offer**
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Excellent office environment
* Work-life balance
* Empowering environment


**Ready to take the next step on your career journey?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2026.03.01. If you have questions about the position, please contact Elinor Franzén, Talent Acquisition Partner, at elinor.franzen@seb.se.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Java Developer at Technology Trading FX | SEB, Sweden
description:
Join our FX (Foreign Exchange) Sales Frontend development team as a Solution Developer, where your development of software with high quality mindset will make a real difference. This is mainly JavaScript/Java and building CD/CI automated pipelines for keeping good quality assurance.
   

  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a developer in our FX Sales Frontend development team, you will work hands-on with new and updating features for the Foreign Exchange, that our traders and external customers use.
   

  

 As a developer, you will be part of a cross-functional team consisting of developers, quality engineers, a UX designer, a Scrum Master, and a Product Owner.
   

  

 In this role, you will primarily work with Java and JavaScript, using frameworks such as Spring Boot and Angular, and collaborate closely with the business throughout the software development lifecycle.
   

  

 As a person we believe that you are passionate about development, really enjoy coding and eager to constantly learn and develop new skills. You take responsibility for software quality, writing maintainable and efficient code that holds up over time. Its meriting if you have knowledge or interest in foreign exchange or trading in general and can communicate in both English and Swedish.
   

  

 Your analytical mindset will be essential for understanding complex FX trading data.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Experience in software development, with an interest in building, maintaining, and evolving systems over time.
* Ability and interest in understanding the system beyond individual components.
* Proficiency in Java and/or JavaScript.
* A relevant degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
* An analytical mindset.
* Familiarity with DevOps practices and contribution to automated workflows for build, testing, security scanning, and deployment; containerization (e.g. Docker) is an advantage.


**Nice To Have**
* Experience working in a financial context, such as FX.


**What We Offer**
* A cross-functional team with modern development practices.
* A flat organization with open discussion and shared responsibility.
* Time and support for learning as part of everyday work.
* Work on complex systems that play an important role in the financial infrastructure.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial to our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2026-02-25. If you have questions about the position, please contact Martin Götze, 0707392378, note that we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes, for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career https://bit.ly/SEBcareer
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Soundtrap is a cloud-based digital audio workstation (DAW) that is reimagining how music and podcasts are created. Made by music producers, songwriters, and audio experts, our goal is to help you unlock your creative potential. Our mission is to enable music and podcast creation for everyone, no matter where in the world you are or what device you are using.
 



  





 Join the Soundtrap team as we develop the world’s leading web based DAW. While many Soundtrappers are based in Stockholm, we are a remote first company with presence in a number of European countries.
 



  





 As a software engineer in our Growth team, you'll be working at the intersection between engineering, marketing and business, driving initiatives that help Soundtrap reach more creators.  You’ll contribute to initiatives focused on discoverability, acquisition, and conversion, using experimentation and data to understand how users engage with our product. If you are passionate about music and enjoy building and growing web products, you’ll find this role both fun and rewarding.
 



  





 We value people who are flexible and passionate about what they do. While experience in the technologies we use at Soundtrap is an advantage, we’re equally interested in strong software engineering fundamentals, a curiosity to learn, and a genuine love for our product. If that sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





**What you'll do** 



* Be a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional agile team working closely with marketing and product.
* Participate in fast-paced experimentation to improve user understanding, conversion, and onboarding.
* Influence technical decisions within the team and collaborate with other engineers to drive alignment and best practices across Soundtrap.
* Work across a broad problem space through fast-paced experimentation. The team’s scope ranges from improving landing pages, Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) & Answer Engine Optimisation (AEO), building features for targeting marketing campaigns, evolving our pricing strategy, to optimizing the checkout funnel. The work is varied, dynamic, and consistently engaging.
* Build and evolve landing pages and content-driven experiences, working with CMS integrations to enable scalable and flexible content management.
* Grow with us and learn all there is to know on scaling a complex web application, both on the technical and business side.



  





**Who you are** 



* You have a good understanding of modern web application architecture and hands-on experience delivering production systems at scale.
* You’re passionate about user experience and full-stack development, with solid experience in frontend frameworks such as React or Angular, and a strong working knowledge of Java.
* You’re comfortable designing solutions, making trade-offs, and taking ownership from idea to production.
* You enjoy measuring user behaviour through experiments and using data to guide decisions.
* You communicate clearly, collaborate well across disciplines, and enjoy helping others grow.
* Experience with Content Management System (CMS) integrations, Dart, SEO, and AEO is a bonus.



  





**Where you'll be** 



* We are a distributed workforce enabling our team members to find a work mode best for them.
* You can choose to work from our Stockholm office or remotely from any of the following countries: Sweden, France, Spain, or the UK. You must have a valid work permit for the country in which you plan to work.



  





 Soundtrap is an equal opportunity employer, and we welcome you as you are. No matter your background, appearance, or taste in music, you belong here. Our platform and our workplace are for everyone. Diverse voices help us thrive, innovate, and push boundaries, so bring your unique experiences and perspectives. Together, we’re shaping the future of how the world creates music.

title: SW developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Very experienced developer in C++, Linux, Rust.
* Holistic understanding of how one change affects the whole.
* Good communicator since you need to understand other teams needs in a large organization.


**Education:**
* Computer Sciences, Robotics, Embedded systems or similar


**Language:**
* Swedish and English


**Meritorious**
* Experience from automotive architecture and processes.
* Experience from working with SAFe.
* Knowledge about automotive electrical system and/or embedded systems in vehicles.
* C/CE driver´s license.


**Application deadline:** 
 20-02-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Creative Developers
description:
*MSAB is a global leader in digital forensic technology for mobile device examination and analysis. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions – for a safer world. A core value is to run an ethics-driven company with innovation and results. The sole focus of MSAB is on delivering high quality digital forensic solutions to collect, review, analyze and manage data. MSAB is a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defence Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption.*
 We love creating great code that matters - and the people who write it. We are always on the look-out for coders skilled in C++ or C# with innovative mindset.
   

  

 If you want to use your coding expertise and problem-solving mindset to make the world more transparent, safer, and more democratic? At MSAB, you can turn that ambition into reality.
   

  

 We’re a global leader in digital forensics, building advanced tools used worldwide to solve crimes, fight corruption, investigate fraud, and support justice. Here, your code has real-world impact.
   

  

**Possibilities**
 As a developer at MSAB, you’ll dive deep into complex and highly technical challenges - exactly the kind that motivate curious, inventive engineers.
   

  

**Your Work Might Involve**
* Extracting and decrypting data from mobile devices
* Writing decoders, parsers, and low-level implementations
* Reverse-engineering apps and making complex data structures readable
* Implementing efficient, high-performance code in C++
* Working close to hardware, embedded systems, Android, or iOS internals


 If that excites you - you’re exactly who we want to meet.
   

  

**Our Culture**
 Our culture is friendly, supportive, and built on shared learning and technical curiosity. You’ll thrive here if you enjoy autonomy, like exploring new ideas, and want to grow by stepping outside your comfort zone.
   

  

 There’s much more to tell you about our tech stack, vision, innovation and ways of working, and the opportunities ahead. But let’s save that for future conversations.
   

  

 Ready to build software that makes a real difference?
   

  

 Send your application today.
   

  

 For more information about MSAB, please visit: http://www.msab.com
   

  

 What we can offer
   

  

 Create a safer world with us!
   

  

 As one of the world’s leading digital forensics companies, MSAB leads the way in pioneering advancements that contribute to making our world safer.
   

  

 Your work at MSAB will bridge the gap between technology and justice. You will be inspired to go beyond your comfort zone, and you will deal with challenging and meaningful projects. When you join us, you become part of a global team that aspires to create a safer digital future, one breakthrough at a time.
   

  

 We can offer you an exciting work environment, where we value being innovative, acting ethically and delivering results in everything we do while our customers' needs are at the center. We are proud to be a fast-growing international company with more than 20+ nationalities and we work with things that really make a difference.
   

  

 Every day at MSAB is an opportunity to redefine the future of digital forensics.
   

  

 Are you up for the challenge?
   

  

 Department Development Locations Stockholm, Sweden Remote status Hybrid

title: Developer - AI Team
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**About The Role**
*Join Our AI Team – Build Tech That Transforms Everyday Life!*
**Our Mission**
 We're on a bold journey to supercharge how the Odevo group companies operate by making artificial intelligence an integral part of how work gets done. As an AI Engineer, you’ll help create solutions that impact millions of homes and daily routines—making life smarter, easier, and more connected.
   

  

**What You’ll Work On**
 Our scope is broad and future-focused, giving you the chance to explore multiple areas of AI innovation:
   

  

* Intelligent Automation: Build systems that understand and process massive amounts of information—from text documents and spreadsheets to chat and email conversations from customer service.
* Agent Framework & Evals: Design and implement an agentic framework with robust evaluation pipelines, covering reliability, safety, and performance, so we can continuously measure, improve, and trust the behavior of our AI systems.
* Real Products, Not Just POCs: Ship and own real, production-grade AI products. You will be involved end to end, from prototype to deployment to ongoing maintenance, making sure what we build is used, loved, and delivering measurable value for users.


 In short: you’ll join a high-speed innovation track where your work shapes how we use AI moving forward.
   

  

**Your Role**
* Design and implement AI-powered solutions using cutting-edge generative AI and LLMs.
* Collaborate with engineers, designers, and product managers to turn ideas into impactful products.
* Stay ahead of the curve—experiment with the latest AI breakthroughs and bring them into production.
* Share knowledge and inspire other teams across the organization.


**Who You Are**
* A passionate software engineer with hands-on experience in generative AI.
* Skilled in Python (FastAPI) and React—or open to learning new tools for the right task.
* Experienced in building real-world applications for users.
* Curious, collaborative, and always exploring new tech developments.
* Fluent in Swedish and ready to demo your skills.


**What We Offer**
* A playground for innovation with the latest tech and tools.
* A culture that values creativity, ownership, and fun.
* Hybrid work setup in Stockholm with three days at the office—balance focus and collaboration.


 Ready to Shape the Future of AI?
   

  

 Apply now and let’s build something extraordinary together!

title: Product Developer Basic Jersey - H&M Womenswear
description:
**Job Description**

*Are you passionate about fashion, driven by results, and excited about turning creative ideas into commercial success? We are looking for a Product Developer with a strategic mindset, a passion for product, and a collaborative spirit to join our Basic Jersey team at H&M Womenswear.*




*This is a full‑time position based at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden.*




  

  

**WHAT YOU’LL DO** 
**​**
  

 In this role as a Product Developer, you’ll play an important part in shaping the H&M Women Basic Jersey assortment. You’ll define and drive both short‑ and long‑term plans for your category, ensuring they align with our overall assortment direction. With a sharp eye for jersey, a strong commercial understanding and the ability to translate trends into relevant product opportunities, you’ll identify seasonal keys and respond quickly to what’s emerging. You’ll continuously refine our product and component work to build a strong and competitive jersey offer.
   

  





 You’ll take ideas all the way from concept to final product- pushing development forward and securing smooth coordination across teams in a fast‑moving environment. You’ll work closely with a Product Manager, Planner, Designer and Pattern Maker and collaborate with our production team to bring each piece to life with the right quality, fit and feel. Your passion for jersey and your drive to make things happen will be essential in creating high‑quality, on‑trend products that truly resonate with our customers.
   

  





  

  





**WHO YOU ARE** 
**​**




 Qualifications:
   

  




* 5+ years of experience from a similar role as Product Developer or Buyer
* Extensive experience in jersey is highly meritorious
* Education in Textiles, Buying, Fashion or Product Development
* Proven track record in creating products for the womenswear customer with a great sense of fashion and impeccable taste
* A keen eye for current fashion trends with strong fashion intelligence
* A deep passion for products and product development
* Driven, structured and proactive in taking initiatives
* Salesmanship and results oriented
* Excellent communication skills
* A strong team player with a flexible attitude
* Ability to identify opportunities, improvements and efficient solutions



  

  





**WHO WE ARE** 
**​**
  

 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.​
   

  





 ​We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. ​
   

  





 ​
   

  





**JOIN US** 
**​
   

  

 Additional information**
  

 This is a
 **full-time position based at our HQ in Stockholm** 
 .  If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible. Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal applicants, please remember to initiate a dialogue with your manager before applying).
   

  





 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.​
   

  





**Benefits:**
  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  





  

  





**Inclusion & Diversity:**
  

 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  





 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  





  

  





**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**Do you want to build B2C solutions that are used at scale – and actually matter to end users?**
 As a Fullstack Developer at GlobalConnect, you will be part of a team that owns the full B2C portal experience, from frontend to backend.
   

  

 If you enjoy variety, responsibility, and building solutions that are continuously evolving, this is a role where you can really make your mark. The role combines new development, integrations, and continuous improvement in a high-impact B2C environment. You will work across the entire value chain. Close collaboration with stakeholders, users, and business teams is a natural part of your day, and you combine technical insight with a strong sense of ownership. You will work in an agile setup, collaborating daily with other developers, product owners, and you take responsibility for both delivery and quality.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain B2C portals using modern frontend and backend technologies
* Work end-to-end with both frontend and backend development
* Build customer-specific portal solutions on top of a shared platform base
* Design and implement REST APIs and integrations with third-party systems
* Collaborate closely with business stakeholders and users to shape solutions
* Contribute actively in agile ceremonies and continuous delivery


**What You Need To Succeed**
* Strong experience in modern Spring Boot microservice development (Java, preferably Java 21)
* Solid experience designing and working with REST APIs
* Experience with Angular 20 for frontend development
* Experience working with Git and agile methodologies (Scrum)


 Beyond the technical skills, you are comfortable working in a stakeholder-heavy environment and enjoy being part of discussions that span both technology and business. Experience with designing and developing accessible digital solutions with a clear understanding of WCAG compliance is a plus, but not required.
   

  

**The team & collaboration**
 You will join a fullstack team with mixed seniority and strong collaboration. The team is distributed across several locations and works closely together using agile ways of working. Daily standups, close collaboration, and a strong sense of ownership are key parts of the team culture.
   

  

**Why join this role**
 This is a role for someone who wants to work broadly as a fullstack developer and take real ownership of complete solutions. You will be part of a long-term journey, continuously developing new functionality and delivering value at scale in a high-impact B2C context.
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: DESIGNER / PRODUCT DEVELOPER
description:
**THE ESSENCE:** 




  





 c’est normal is a Scandinavian lifestyle brand redefining what’s normal. We create timeless, high-quality products built for creatives on the move to merge work, play and leisure.
 



 Products are at the core of everything we do. This role sits at the heart of our product engine, shaping how ideas turn into real, long-lasting products ready for daily use.
 



  





**WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR:** 




  





 We’re looking for a Designer / Product Developer to step into a key role during our Designer/Product Developer’s maternity leave. You’ll own the product development process from initial development through final production, ensuring precision, durability, and consistency across collections, while working closely with our Senior Buyer and Creative Director.
 



 This role requires a deep technical understanding of fabrics, washes, dyes, trims, construction, and garment detailing, with the ability to assess feasibility, manage risk, and guide suppliers in solving issues as they arise. A strong working knowledge of pattern logic and fit development is required.
 



  





  





 Please apply at:
 



 https://cestnormal.com/blogs/work-with-us/designer-product-developer-maternity-cover

title: Full stack developer & Tech Lead (Kotlin+React)
description:
Our client is responsible for a product used by their retailers and service advisors all around the world. By using new modern technologies, they establish effective resale operations by providing accurate and optimized information to their service employees.
   

  

**Therefore we are searching for someone…**
 Who enjoys working in a team that takes full responsibility for developing and deploying their application to production.
   

  

 You are comfortable with development practices such as event-driven architecture, trunk-based development
   

  

 and continuous deployment.
   

  

 You have the judgment to know when not to ship, the clarity to explain why something is a bad idea, and a
   

  

 focus on building systems that allow teams to move fast with confidence.
   

  

 We also believe that you have previous experience working with back-end development, but front-end and
   

  

 AWS development are also very relevant. But most importantly, you are passionate about technology and
   

  

 continuous learning, as well taking on a senior position within the team, teaching and guiding other
   

  

 developers. You have a burning passion for continuous delivery and rigorous automation.
   

  

**As a part of the team…**
 You will have the chance to work with bleeding-edge technologies while pushing the boundaries of what is possible when building and delivering fast and reliable software.
   

  

 We equally encourage and value innovation with modern technology as we do refine our current software
   

  

 stack to make sure our entire application and practices are always challenged and up to date.
   

  

 In this role you will be sharing the responsibility of maintaining and developing some of the micro frontends
   

  

 together with some microservices, that make the entire application. The application is entirely cloud-based,
   

  

 deployed in Kubernetes in AWS by GitLab CI pipelines, with React micro-front-ends and backed with Kotlin
   

  

 micro-services. A lot of communication between internal and external services is done through Kafka.
   

  

 As a team, we generally work remotely, usually having one team day a week in the office where we enjoy each other’s company face-to-face. While we expect everyone to be independent and take ownership of their own learning, we are always working closely together sharing the knowledge and decisions between us, and thus we believe your personality plays a big role in your value to the team
   

  

 Start: Flex
   

  

 Length: 6 months with possibility to extend.
   

  

 Workplace: Stockholm - 1 day per week at the office.
   

  

 We are also looking for several candidates for this role.

title: Senior Frontend Engineer - Session Replay / Grafana Cloud | Sweden | Remote
description:
Grafana Labs is a remote-first, open-source powerhouse. There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies -- including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay -- manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).
   

  

 We’re scaling fast and staying true to what makes us different: an open-source legacy, a global collaborative culture, and a passion for meaningful work. Our team thrives in an innovation-driven environment where transparency, autonomy, and trust fuel everything we do.
   

  

 You may not meet every requirement, and that’s okay. If this role excites you, we’d love you to raise your hand for what could be a truly career-defining opportunity.
   

  

**Senior Frontend Engineer - Session Replay / Grafana Cloud**
**This is a remote opportunity and we would be interested in applicants based in Spain, Germany, Ireland, the UK or Sweden at this time.**
**The Opportunity**
**About Session Replay squad**
 The Session Replay squad is building a new Grafana Cloud product that helps our customers to understand what users actually experienced when something goes wrong.
   

  

 Session Replay connects frontend signals (errors, performance, synthetic checks) to concrete session-level evidence, enabling faster and more confident investigation of production issues.
   

  

**This Team Works At The Intersection Of**
* frontend observability,
* debugging workflows,
* privacy and access control,
* performance and cost constraints at scale.


 Session Replay is still early, which means you’ll help shape both what we build and how it fits into Grafana Cloud.
   

  

 As a company we are remote-first and global, we embrace people of different experiences and backgrounds to build diverse teams where every person brings a new perspective to the software. We are looking for Frontend Engineers who are passionate about communicating with data and providing seamless experiences for our customers to join our growing team! Our stack is Typescript + React (interacting with backends written in Golang), but we build tools for people using many other stacks.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a Senior Frontend Engineer on the Session Replay squad, you will:
   

  

* Own all aspects of the Session Replay player and investigation workflows, from user interaction to performance and correctness.
* Lead the design and implementation of complex, stateful frontend systems involving timelines, overlays, large datasets, and partially available data.
* Lead discussions with other teams (Frontend Observability, Synthetic Monitoring, Core Grafana) to integrate replay seamlessly into broader investigation workflows across Grafana Cloud products.
* Implement visual designs using clean, reusable components.
* Improve internal tooling, patterns, and shared components where needed.
* Help grow the team by interviewing candidates, mentoring engineers, and supporting onboarding.


**Technologies you'll work with**
* React
* TypeScript
* Golang


**What Makes You a Great Fit**
* You are comfortable working in a remote-first company; communication is key.
* For us, working together means being collaborative, friendly, kind, and respectful. We operate by consensus. You can contribute to a discussion, disagree constructively, and commit to the team’s decision. You are able to communicate design decisions clearly in written and spoken English.
* You have strong experience as a Frontend Engineer, and are comfortable owning features in ambiguous problem spaces.. We are a small team, working remotely, on a product that will be used by engineers all over the world – the ability to work on your own is crucial.
* You have a good understanding of a software development process that takes a user-centered approach. You easily build an understanding of the users’ context and goals which will help you build the right solution with the maximum value.
* You know how to transform ideas into working code – you are able to design a solution, get feedback, and write a prototype by yourself.
* You enjoy working on complex solutions – Grafana is a highly technological solution and has avid followers who rely on it every day and who care deeply about their workflows. You value code maintainability, readability & automation.
* You are able to troubleshoot modern web application issues and work with profilers, debuggers, bundlers, and testing libraries.


**Bonus Points For**
* Experience with observability tools (Grafana, Datadog, New Relic, Sentry, etc.).
* Experience building debugging or developer-focused tools.
* Familiarity with Storybook, Jest, React Testing Library, or Playwright.
* Experience dealing with performance-sensitive UIs (large lists, timelines, media playback).
* Understanding of privacy, security, or access control concerns in frontend applications.


 In Sweden, the base compensation range for this role is SEK 738,518 - SEK 886,222. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed throughout the interview process. All of our roles include Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), giving every team member ownership in Grafana Labs' success. We believe in shared outcomes—RSUs help us stay aligned and invested as we scale globally.
   

  

* Compensation ranges are country specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.


**Why You’ll Thrive At Grafana Labs**
* 100% Remote, Global Culture - As a remote-only company, we bring together talent from around the world, united by a culture of collaboration and shared purpose.
* Scaling Organization – Tackle meaningful work in a high-growth, ever-evolving environment.
* Transparent Communication – Expect open decision-making and regular company-wide updates.
* Innovation-Driven – Autonomy and support to ship great work and try new things.
* Open Source Roots – Built on community-driven values that shape how we work.
* Empowered Teams – High trust, low ego culture that values outcomes over optics.
* Career Growth Pathways – Defined opportunities to grow and develop your career.
* Approachable Leadership – Transparent execs who are involved, visible, and human.
* Passionate People – Join a team of smart, supportive folks who care deeply about what they do.
* In-Person onboarding - We want you to thrive from day 1 with your fellow new ‘Grafanistas’ to learn all about what we do and how we do it.
* Balance is Key - We operate a global annual leave policy of 30 days per annum. 3 days of your annual leave entitlement are reserved for Grafana Shutdown Days to allow the team to really disconnect. \*We will comply with local legislation where applicable.


**Equal Opportunity Employer:** 
 We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.
   

  

*Grafana Labs may utilize AI tools in its recruitment process to assist in matching information provided in CVs to job postings. The recruitment team will continue to review inbound CVs manually to identify alignment with current openings.*
*For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy.*

title: iOS Developer
description:
**Join Truecaller – The place where innovation meets impact!** 




  





 Truecaller's mission is to build trust in communication by making it safer, smarter, and more efficient. Born in Sweden, trusted by the world, and here’s why we stand out:
 


* We are trusted by over 450 million active users every month across 190+ countries
* We identify over 15 billion calls daily, helping users avoid spam and scams
* We are powered by a team of 450+ employees from 45+ nationalities



  





 We always look for people who take initiative, own their work, and keep raising the bar. An entrepreneurial mindset matters here, especially when it turns bold ideas into real actions. We stay collaborative and focused, always searching for smarter paths forward. If you want to make an impact and grow with a team that inspires millions, you’ll fit right in.
 



  





**The role:** 




  





**We at the iOS team** 
 are a bunch of the crazy ones, the misfits, the rebels, the troublemakers. We ideate and build all of the Truecaller iOS app. Our vision is to take our love for Apple products and build a great iOS app with beauty, care & affection.
 



  





**As a Software Engineer, iOS** 
 you will have an impact on how our users use the iOS app, you will be working on the whole app from the authentication to the search feature, and you will also work very closely with all the other teams in the company to achieve our company vision: enabling each person or business to maintain a secure and trusted online identity.
 



  





**What you’ll do:** 



* Design, develop, and maintain the company's iOS application
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of the app
* Debug complex technical issues and identify solutions to improve the app
* Stay up-to-date with new technologies and trends in iOS development
* Write clean, maintainable, and scalable code
* Participate in code reviews and ensure adherence to coding standards
* Contribute to the technical design and architecture of the app
* Participate in the full software development life cycle, including planning, development, testing, and deployment.



  





**What you bring in:** 



* 3-5 years of overall experience with iOS development
* Advanced knowledge of programming using Swift
* Deep understanding and several years of hands-on experience in Cocoa and iOS application development (architectures, design, tools, SDKs), asynchronous server communication, and UX optimization
* Experience in agile development
* Fluent communication skills in oral and written English



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 



* SwiftUI experience
* Swift async/await experience
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools like GitHub Actions and Fastlane



  





**What we offer:** 




 We support growth through learning resources, leadership programs, mentoring, and real hands-on work. People can move between teams and projects to build new skills and keep things interesting. We offer clear internal mobility and a transparent path for progression, with leaders who stay involved and provide guidance throughout the year. In addition, you will benefit from:
 









  









* **A comprehensive compensation package:** 
 We offer a competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension, and wellness contributions.
* **Modern tools to do your best work:** 
 Choose your preferred computer and phone within our budget, so you can work comfortably and efficiently.
* **A people-focused office culture:** 
 We value in-person collaboration and follow an office-first model, with some flexibility. Our offices offer a vibrant environment with opportunities to learn, connect, and recharge, from breakfast, lunch, and well-stocked snack stations and quiet spaces to team activities such as movie nights, tech meetups, and cultural events. There's something for everyone.
* **Truecaller’s “Lab Days” offer a space for imagination:** 
 5 times per year for 3 days, where everyone steps away from their normal tasks to explore new, bold ideas and build things they’ve always wanted to. It’s a space where curiosity leads the way, and prototypes take shape. Some concepts even make it into production, and a few have grown into real features used by millions today. Lab Days allow you to be creative, learn fast, and help shape Truecaller's future.
