Hantering av projekt, initiativ eller andra leveransfokuserade arbetsflöden är hjärtat i vår verksamhet, och vi tvekar aldrig att ta risker för att bevisa vårt värde.
 



 Läs mer på www.stelltec.se.
 



  





**Vi ingår i Newground Alliance** 




 Newground Alliance är en allians av oberoende nischkonsultbolag som tillsammans skapar värdefulla synergieffekter. Alla bolag är ”sina egna” och drivs självständigt, men som konsult har du möjligheter att samverka med konsulter från övriga bolag, ta hjälp av experter och utbyta kunskap. Alla bolagen delar lokaler på Norrmalmstorg vilket skapar spontana och värdefulla möten i vardagen.
 



 We are a consulting company focused on IT delivery management. We are a team of experienced, delivery-focused IT consultants with the skills, know-how and passion for taking on our clients’ most challenging projects – maximizing the value of their IT investments. Read more at www.stelltec.se

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
At Billogram we like to be the good guys of billing, making money when clients are happy and pay on time rather than from missed payments. We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That’s why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain and instead be of gain to both our clients and their customers – improving their relations.
 



  





 To ensure continuous growth and become a leader in the European consumer billing market we are looking for a Customer Success Manager to join our team.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 As Customer Success Manager, your primary responsibility is to act as a trusted strategic advisor to our clients. You'll drive profitability and customer retention by ensuring clients achieve their desired outcomes with our product. You will serve as the main point of contact for a number of large and mid-sized clients, gaining a deep understanding of their business goals and challenges.
 



  





 In this role, you are the one who connects the dots. You zoom out to see the big picture and ensure that every decision made along the way supports the long-term commercial success of the partnership. You aren't afraid to take charge, drive your own agenda, and lead both internal and external stakeholders to ensure we deliver real value.
 



  





**Primary responsibilities:** 



* **Strategic Account Ownership:** 
 You develop and drive the client agenda, creating account plans with specific goals and breaking them down into impactful activities.
* **Commercial Drive:** 
 You focus on maximizing client lifetime value by identifying business opportunities and leading complex contract negotiations, often at C-level.
* **Stakeholder Management:** 
 You act as a cross-functional leader, coordinating efforts across different teams at Billogram to ensure the client journey is successful.
* **Influence Product Development:** 
 You act as a strategic bridge between the market and our product team, providing crucial feedback to ensure our roadmap aligns with high-impact client needs.
* **Drive Process Improvement:** 
 You take the lead on developing and implementing your own initiatives to improve and streamline processes and ways of working within the Customer Success team.
* **Lead and Escalate:** 
 You have the ability to classify issues and the confidence to drive them to resolution, escalating when necessary to protect the business and the customer experience.



  





**What we are looking for:** 




 We are looking for a self-starter who is comfortable taking the lead and acting as a clear, guiding voice for our clients. You excel at building trusted relationships and navigating complex stakeholder landscapes with ease. While you are confident in your expertise and able to be a decisive voice in a room, you always remain humble and genuinely curious about the people and businesses you support. You are highly organized and possess a strong ability to zoom out and connect the dots to see the logic and connections in complex environments.
 



  





**What will help you succeed:** 



* Proven experience in managing a client portfolio and driving formal account plans and review cycles.
* Experience in initiating and leading complex contract negotiations and renegotiations, ideally at C-level.
* Solid skills in acting as a cross-functional project leader, coordinating complex client journeys and outcomes by leveraging internal teams (e.g., sales, product, tech).
* Industry experience from the payment landscape or our focus verticals (Telecom, Utilities, Insurance) is a plus.
* Experience from working in a start-up/scale-up environment within SaaS is beneficial.
* Bachelor's degree in business administration or equivalent is beneficial.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken is a requirement.



  





**What we offer:** 




 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
 



  





 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
 



  





*At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.* 




 Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: Regional Sales Manager (Nordics)
description:
**About the company** 




 A specialist in identity, secure transactions, and digital services,
 **IN Groupe** 
 is the global leader in secure identity and trust services. Every day, our 4,000 employees across 40 countries work to ensure that everyone has access to a reliable and secure identity, both in the physical and digital worlds. With our solutions and our international network of 10 R&D centers, we support governments and businesses in more than 130 countries.
 



 Joining IN Groupe means helping to shape the future of the identity and secure transaction market. Become part of our international teams — driven by innovation and proud to design solutions that make life easier and protect personal data for millions of people around the world.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As a
 **Regional Sales Manager** 
 in the Nordics, you will play a strategic role in building strong, sustainable customer relationships that position
 **IN Groupe** 
 as the preferred partner for corporate access credentials. You’ll drive high‑level engagement with key market players, expand our presence by
 **identifying and penetrating new accounts** 
 , and ensure customers and partners experience a seamless, friction‑free journey when proposing, quoting, and sourcing our solutions.
 



  





**Location** 
 : EUROPE – NORDICS, CENTRAL EUROPE (BENELUX, POLAND, BALTICS, GERMANY, AUSTRIA, BALKANS)
 



  





**Main responsibilities** 



* Support and
 **develop existing customers** 
 by continuously increasing and reinforcing awareness and understanding of our offering, and influence all levels within our customers’ organization
* Quickly follow-up sales opportunities converted from Marketing leads
* Manage and control your sales funnel (from
 **prospecting to closing)** 
 to achieve your target
* Be the relay at
 **local events** 
 (conferences, seminars and presentations) supported by the marketing department
* Advise executives and support functions on local market specifics
* Capture & prioritize the roadmap needs from the customers’ perspective, coordinate regular meetings between product teams of IN Groupe and the customers to ensure there is a clear and up to date understanding of:



 – How customers use our products and the dependencies involved
 



 – Missing features or capabilities
 



 – Future evolutions required
 


1. – Opportunities for growth and expansion
2. -Industry / market trends


* Create and maintain customers key contacts mapping, which ensures



 - All key decision makers at the customers, impacting IN Groupe business growth are clearly identified
 



 -All major stakeholders at IN Groupe and the customers can identify their relevant counterparts, and understand communication/escalation guidelines to support an efficient and productive business partnership
 


* Track and report on
 **customers sales trends** 
 (by product, by region & by market (horizontal and vertical where possible)



  





**About you** 



* Bachelor’s, Master’s degree or MBA
* Minimum of 5 years experience in the IT, cybersecurity, or software industry
* **Proven B2B Sales or Pre-sales background** 
 with strong partner-management experience with
 **solutions selling skills.**
* Excellent
 **communication abilities** 
 , including presentations, written communication, and active listening
* Strong
 **interpersonal skills** 
 with the ability to build and maintain trusted relationships
* Comfortable working within an
 **international environment** 
 and collaborating across borders
* Self‑driven, motivated, and accountable for delivering results
* Proactive in identifying
 **customer needs** 
 and recommending actionable solutions
* **Willingness to travel** 
 as required
* French language skills are a plus, though not mandatory

title: Fullstack Developer with Backend Focus
description:
*At Storykit, we believe great content should never go unseen. Too many overworked teams create brilliant blog posts, customer stories, and reports, only to post them once and watch them disappear. Our AI-powered text-to-video platform changes that, automatically transforming written content into multiple short, scroll-stopping videos for LinkedIn and beyond. We keep brands visible relevant, and impossible to ignore.* 




 Fullstack Developer
 
**How will you make life easier for millions of storytellers worldwide:** 



 The heart of our business is to make it easy and fast for our users to create really good looking videos, and with the increase in users and video renders, we always strive to improve the way we build and render the videos for our users to be faster and more efficient.
 





 Your responsibilities include: 
 



* Implementing features and functionality using mainly TypeScript, Node.js and Angular
* Deploying your code, ensuring that it’s well tested and working as expected
* Troubleshooting and debugging systems to ensure reliability and performance
* Reviewing other developers’ code and working together with the team to find the best solutions
* Contributing to the continuous improvement of our technical architecture and design



**What about the tech?** 



 We use Angular and Typescript to build the frontend of our web application.
 





 Our backend is built using Node.js, Express and Typescript, structured as microservices and running on AWS Kubernetes, with Github Actions powering our CI/CD pipelines.
 





 Our data layer is built on MongoDB, using Mongoose for schema modelling, and we process background jobs through BullMQ.
 




**What can you expect from us?** 



 You’ll join a close-knit team of around 10 developers in a safe and open-minded environment that is both challenging and ambitious. We work as a single, cross-functional full-stack team, owning everything from feature design and development to testing, release, and maintenance in production. Collaboration, autonomy, and ownership are at the core of how we work at Storykit. You’ll be responsible for meaningful work from the start and supported as you take on ambitious goals, working closely with DevOps, UI/UX, and Product Management. You will work in an awesome team with generous terms and conditions.
 




**Who are we looking for - really?** 



 You’re an experienced TypeScript developer who has worked on modern web applications and feels comfortable building and maintaining Angular applications in a professional environment.
 

  

  



 In addition to this, we believe that you:
 



* Have at least five years of experience working with backend or fullstack development
* Are comfortable communicating in English
* Enjoy collaborating with others, sharing knowledge, and learning from your teammates



**Join the fun!** 



 You will work with the base at our HQ in central Stockholm. We hope you’re up for the challenge and look forward to hearing more about you. Submit your application today!

title: GTM Associate
description:
Pocketlaw is seeking a highly motivated, engaged and results-driven GTM Associate to join our team amid our exciting growth journey in Legal AI.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone with a commercial background, keen to work at the intersection of business, legal and technology, and eager to see the impact and value that Legal AI can create for large businesses.
   

  

 As an GTM Associate, you will work closely with prospective clients throughout a sales cycle from the initial discovery call through to close. By asking the right questions, and supplying market and product insight you will display how our innovative AI solutions can enable them to work with control, consistency and speed.
   

  

 You will report directly to our VP GTM and have significant opportunities for professional development within a fast-paced, dynamic and fun company.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Business Development & Lead Generation – Identify and engage potential clients through outbound prospecting, networking, and social selling
* Product Demonstrations – Present and showcase Pocketlaw’s AI-powered tools, explaining how they can streamline legal processes
* Relationship Building – Develop strong relationships with decision-makers by understanding their legal and business needs
* Pipeline & Deal Management – Track and manage your sales pipeline to ensure a steady flow of opportunities through to close.


**Qualifications**
* +2 years of experience in Sales, Business Development, Management Consulting or some other commercial role, preferably at a B2B SaaS company but also Legal organisations.
* Intelligent, strong communicator with strong interpersonal skills
* Driven, self-motivated, and eager to achieve and exceed targets
* Interest and/or knowledge about AI and the digital transformation of legal work
* Fluency in Swedish and English
* Business, Science or Law degree from a top university
* Preferably with some legal experience, knowledge or background


**Key Competencies**
* Proactive: Takes initiative and works independently to drive sales outcomes
* Results-Oriented: Focused on achieving and exceeding sales targets
* Team Player: Works well within a team, contributing to collective goals
* Strong Communicator: Excellent verbal and written communication skills


**Salary & Location**
* Competitive base, with a commission structure to enable high earnings based on performance.
* A dynamic work place at the intersection of legal and tech
* A warm and welcoming office in central Stockholm


**About Pocketlaw**
 Pocketlaw is an AI legal tech company reimagining legal work for every team. We enable companies to centralise legal processes and automate contract management through intuitive tools, automation, and AI. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices in London, Pocketlaw is rapidly expanding after continued revenue growth.
   

  

**Join us at Pocketlaw and be a part of the future of legal tech!**
 Miramis Technologies helps companies solve their everyday legal needs - empowering every team in the organisation to create contracts and manage legal with efficiency, ease and confidence. Miramis is transforming legal for businesses; turning it from a business blocker into a business enabler - with the end goal of giving every company in the world legal peace of mind.

title: eCommerce Key Account Manager
description:
**Kenvue Is Currently Recruiting For A:**
 eCommerce Key Account Manager
   

  

****What We Do****
 At Kenvue, we realize the extraordinary power of everyday care. Built on over a century of heritage and rooted in science, we’re the house of iconic brands - including NEUTROGENA®, AVEENO®, TYLENOL®, LISTERINE®, JOHNSON’S® and BAND-AID® that you already know and love. Science is our passion; care is our talent.
   

  

****Who We Are****
 Our global team is ~ 22,000 brilliant people with a workplace culture where every voice matters, and every contribution is appreciated. We are passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage – and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future–and yours. For more information, click here.
   

  

****Role Reports To:****
 General Manager Nordics
   

  

**Location:**
 Europe/Middle East/Africa, Sweden, Stockholm, Solna
   

  

**Work Location:**
 Hybrid
   

  

****What You Will Do****
 Kenvue is currently looking for:
   

  

**Ecommerce Key Account Manager – Nordics**
 Location: Solna (Sweden)
   

  

 Reports to: Nordic Head of E-commerce
   

  

****Who We Are****
 Our global team is ~ 22,000 brilliant people with a workplace culture where every voice matters, and every contribution is appreciated. We are passionate about insights, innovation and committed to delivering the best products to our customers. With expertise and empathy, being a Kenvuer means having the power to impact millions of people every day. We put people first, care fiercely, earn trust with science and solve with courage - and have brilliant opportunities waiting for you! Join us in shaping our future-and yours. For more information, click here.
   

  

****What You Will Do****
 Own, grow, and optimize strategic online retail partnerships across the Nordics to deliver revenue, market share, and profitability. You will lead end-to-end commercial execution (P&L, forecasting, content, retail media, promotions, innovation launches), build joint business plans, and unlock growth through key pure-players/omnichannel retailers. You will operate with agility, curiosity, and a founder’s mindset to pilot new tactics, scale what works, and challenge the status quo.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

**Account Ownership & Commercial Delivery**
* Own day-to-day relationships with priority eCommerce partners; lead eJBPs and annual agreements to maximize profitable growth.
* Full, accurate forecasting and P&L ownership for your accounts, delivering on sales, spend and profit targets (INS, TCI, NTS, Net GP).
* Negotiate pricing, terms, promotions, and trade investments; design and execute business plans and promotional calendars aligned to corporate guidelines.
* Build positive, trust-based relationships with buyers and operational contacts (including 3PLs) to ensure flawless execution.


**Sales & Growth Acceleration**
* Deliver revenue and market share targets; create plans that optimize top- and bottom-line performance.
* Identify assortment expansion, bundling, subscription, sampling, and loyalty opportunities; test-and-learn with key retailers to drive engagement and incrementality.
* Maintain an “outside-in” lens on competitor activity and category dynamics to out-perform the market.
* Unlock growth through retail levers such as eventing & full 360 campaigns to drive ROI and share out-performance.


**Digital Shelf & Content Excellence**
* Lead content excellence execution along side ecommerce team (A+ pages, optimized imagery, thumbnails, lifestyle assets), implement best-practice PDP improvements, and elevate search visibility and conversion.
* Adapt global eCommerce playbooks to Nordic markets; build bespoke Swedish assets where needed.
* Drive core capabilities: path-to-purchase understanding, digital shelf metrics, ratings & reviews, retailer A+ content and imagery—partnering with agencies and key platforms.


**Retail Media & Search**
* Lead onsite retail media execution with agency and search specialists; improve ROI of onsite and media investments through structured testing and measurement.


**Innovation & Brand Campaigns**
* Orchestrate best-in-class execution of New Product Introductions (NPI) and integrated brand campaigns to maximize visibility and customer engagement across the channel.


**Data, Insights & Performance Management**
* Analyze performance metrics, shopper behavior, and campaign ROI; translate insights into clear actions and quarterly/Monthly business reviews.
* Monitor and improve online customer experience in partnership with Marketing and Retail/Shopper Excellence; provide regular reporting and actionable insights to stakeholders.


**Cross-Functional Leadership & Operating Rigor**
* Work closely with Supply Chain and Customer Service to ensure eCommerce operations run efficiently (availability, fulfilment, service levels).
* Collaborate with Category Retail Excellence, Shopper Marketing, squads, digital teams, and commercial strategy to identify and land eCommerce opportunities; keep the business informed of progress, challenges, and support needs.
* Ensure a balanced commercial strategy across channels with BU leadership; integrate eCommerce plans for true omni-channel execution and unlock white space.
* Stay current on FMCG/Beauty eCommerce trends and best practices; bring outside-in thought leadership to the Nordics business.


**Required Qualifications**
**What we are looking for**
* Bachelor’s degree (Business Administration or related).
* Progressive experience in Key Account Management and eCommerce account management (or related sales); proven track record of exceeding targets.
* Strong negotiation and storytelling-led communication skills.
* Analytical mindset and proficiency with data tools (Excel, BI platforms).
* Demonstrated growth mindset, bold ambition, and willingness to challenge the status quo.


**Desired Qualifications**
* Ecommerce account management or retailer.com trading experience in Beauty or FMCG.
* Experience with 3PL partnerships and marketplace operations; hands-on with digital content standards and retail media planning.
* Strategic thinker who turns market data into actionable insights; highly organized, detail-oriented, and effective in fast-paced environments.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office and digital shelf tools; entrepreneurial, proactive problem-solver; strong stakeholder management and relationship building.


 Technical/Professional Skills
   

  

* Commercial fundamentals, P&L management, market assessment and targeting.
* Channel understanding, customer needs identification, and digital shelf management.
* Content excellence, search and conversion optimization, ratings & reviews.
* Retail media & shopper planning and measurement; eJBPs for example
* Advanced analytics, turning data into action with clear performance storytelling.


**Ways of Working & Impact**
* Influence & Impact: Consultative selling; persuasive communication; stakeholder alignment at multiple levels; develop creative, mutually beneficial solutions while managing company impact.
* Agility: Challenge the status quo; view opportunities from multiple perspectives; balance short- and long-term decisions; operate confidently in ambiguity with the conviction to lead and the judgment to pivot.


**Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)**
* Sales, INS, TCI, NTS, Net GP delivery and forecast accuracy.
* Digital shelf metrics (content completeness, search rank, SOV), CVR, ratings & reviews.
* Retail media ROI and NPI launch execution quality.
* Share growth vs. competition and effectiveness of test-and-learn pilots.


**Travel**
 Occasional travel within Sweden and the Nordics for customer meetings and internal collaboration.
   

  

****What’s In It For You****
* Paid Company Holidays, Paid Vacation, Volunteer Time & More!
* Learning & Development Opportunities
* Kenvuer Impact Networks
* This list could vary based on location/region


 Kenvue is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment based on merit without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
   

  

 If you are an individual with a disability, please check our Disability Assistance page for information on how to request an accommodation.

title: Information Security Consultant
description:
Som ledande konsultbolag inom säker digitalisering och cybersäkerhet säkrar vi utvecklingen hos våra kunder varje dag. Vi erbjuder allt från strategisk rådgivning vid komplexa utmaningar till helhetsåtaganden inom cybersäkerhet och digitalisering. Vårt uppdrag är att skapa säkra IT-system och lösningar, effektivisera processer, skydda mot cyberhot, hantera lagkrav och bli mer hållbara i en digital värld.
 



  





 Vill du utvecklas och dela med dig av din expertis inom cybersecurity management & resilience? Då kan du vara den vi söker!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Vi söker dig med erfarenhet och intresse för IT- och informationssäkerhet som vill arbeta med spännande uppdrag inom olika branscher och tillsammans med ett härligt gäng kollegor. Din roll kommer att vara central för våra kunder, där ditt engagemang, din lyhördhet och nyfikenhet är av stor vikt.
 



  





**Vi ser gärna att du:** 



* idag och sedan minst 4 år tillbaka arbetar med säkerhet, kanske i en linjeroll eller att du redan idag arbetar som konsult
* har erfarenhet av att arbeta med operativt, systematiskt- och riskbaserat IT- och informationssäkerhetsarbete
* har en god förståelse för organisationers styrning, riskhantering och regelefterlevnadsarbete
* har erfarenhet av säkerhetsrådgivning och granskning inom organisationer
* känner dig bekväm med att delta i projekt för införande av ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet, inklusive certifieringsprocessen
* har god teknisk kunskap samt förståelse för verksamhetens möjligheter och utmaningar inom området
* har akademisk examen eller motsvarande med inriktning mot IT- och informationssäkerhet
* behärskar svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift



  





**Det är även meriterande om du har:** 



* relevanta certifieringar som t.ex. CC, CISM, CISSP, CISA, CRISC
* erfarenhet av lagar och regelverk som t.ex. PCI DSS, GDPR, OSL och NIS
* erfarenhet av standarder som t.ex. MSB metodstöd, ISO 27001 och NIST samt CIS controls



  





 Är det någon certifiering du vill ta men ännu inte har? Inga problem! Vi står för certifieringen och uppmuntrar alltid våra kollegor till fortsatt kompetensutveckling.
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 800 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala och Umeå.
 



  





**Vi satsar på dig - skapa framtiden tillsammans med oss! 🚀** 




 Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i teknikens och cybersäkerhetens framkant – tillsammans med några av branschens mest kompetenta kollegor. Vi tror på att erfarenhet och nyfikenhet går hand i hand, och vi söker dig som vill vara med och utveckla framtidens säkra digitala lösningar.
 



  




* **Kontinuerlig utveckling:** 
 Vi investerar löpande i din kompetens genom utbildningar, certifieringar, mentorskap och kunskapsdelning.
* **Meningsfulla uppdrag:** 
 Du arbetar med uppdrag som gör skillnad – där din insats bidrar till tryggare, mer hållbara och robusta digitala samhällen.
* **Samarbete och gemenskap:** 
 Hos oss råder en kultur av öppenhet och prestigelöshet. Vi lär av varandra, utmanar varandra och delar en gemensam vilja att alltid bli bättre.



  





 Vill du vara en del av ett team som kombinerar teknik, samhällsnytta och kollegial värme – och där din kompetens verkligen gör skillnad? Då är Omegapoint platsen för dig!
 



  





 Har du några funderingar kring tjänsten? Tveka inte på att kontakta petra.soderberg@omegapoint.se.
 



**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! ⤵️**

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**ABOUT SINCH** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



**DESCRIPTION** 




 We are seeking a Data Platform Engineer to build, maintain, and support data infrastructure that powers our products worldwide. In this role, you will be a part of our Data Fabric team, responsible for overseeing our data infrastructure. Your blend of infrastructure expertise and data skills will ensure our operations run smoothly.
 



 This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden, and functions under a hybrid model, reporting to the Engineering Manager.
 



**As our Data Platform Engineer, you will:** 




 As a member of our team, you will develop and maintain our data infrastructure and craft robust monitoring solutions to ensure healthy and stable production systems. You'll also play a crucial role in continuously enhancing the platform with new capabilities to meet evolving business needs. Your expertise in developing powerful, scalable, and maintainable data infrastructure solutions will be essential to the success of our data operations at Sinch.
 


* Lead technically and align with business counterparts.
* Support colleagues and foster a culture of collaboration.
* Define, plan, and implement solutions for arising needs.
* Collaborate with other parts across Sinch optimize and improve existing solutions.
* Support innovation with your expertise and proactive approach.



**REQUIREMENTS** 



* A problem-solver with a strong analytical mindset.
* An experienced professional with 3-6 years of senior-level capacity in Data Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer (SRE),
* Platform Engineer, or Software Engineer.
* Software background is a plus.
* Knowledgeable in one of the three big cloud providers, preferably GCP.
* Proficient in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) e.g., Terraform, Ansible and DevOps procedures.
* Proficiency in SQL, preferably BigQuery.
* Good communication skills.



 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in
 **English.** 




 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation at this time.
 



 Applicants must:
 


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit



**OUR HIRING PROCESS** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Backend Software Engineer - Mimir Ingest | Sweden | Remote
description:
Grafana Labs is a remote-first, open-source powerhouse. There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies -- including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay -- manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).
   

  

 We’re scaling fast and staying true to what makes us different: an open-source legacy, a global collaborative culture, and a passion for meaningful work. Our team thrives in an innovation-driven environment where transparency, autonomy, and trust fuel everything we do.
   

  

 You may not meet every requirement, and that’s okay. If this role excites you, we’d love you to raise your hand for what could be a truly career-defining opportunity.
   

  

**This is a remote opportunity and we would be interested in applicants based in Spain, Germany, Ireland the UK or Sweden at this time.**
**Backend Software Engineer - Mimir Ingest**
**The Opportunity**
**What is Grafana Cloud?**
 Grafana Cloud is our composable observability platform that integrates metrics, logs, traces, and profiles with Grafana. It allows our customers to leverage the best open source observability software – including Prometheus, Mimir, Loki, Tempo, and Pyroscope – without the overhead of installing, maintaining and scaling their own observability stack.
   

  

 The Databases team owns and operates the telemetry databases that are Mimir for metrics, Loki for logs, Tempo for traces, and Pyroscope for profiles. Our databases are offered as a hosted service in Grafana Cloud, and additionally as on-premise solutions with Grafana Enterprise Metrics, Grafana Enterprise Logs, and Grafana Enterprise Traces. They are multi-tenant distributed systems implemented in Go and operating at scale on Kubernetes across all major Cloud service providers (AWS, GCP, Azure).
   

  

 As a company we are remote-first and global, we embrace people of different experiences and backgrounds to build diverse teams where every person brings a new perspective to the software.
   

  

**Mimir Squad**
 The Mimir squad has 3 sub-squads, Ingest, Storage, and Query, which together maintain the Mimir OSS project, and additionally own and operate Grafana Cloud Metrics across 3 major cloud providers. Engineers on the team focus on optimizing the efficiency and resilience of processing, storing, and querying metrics at large volumes. These services operate at a large scale and performance is key to keeping the offering competitive and running smoothly.
   

  

 A Mimir engineer has various work streams. They are likely engaged in a larger project with another engineer, and they are also incorporating some performance and reliability improvements discovered through operating the system in production. They are also responsible for writing and reviewing PRs and design documents from other engineers in the squad, shepherding automated release rollouts, and participating in the on-call rotation for their systems.
   

  

**What will you be doing?**
* Take an active role in influencing our roadmap and your own career objectives
* Work with your team to deliver new features, then use the results to iterate and improve.
* Help your team drive projects from initial idea all the way to operations once it is in the hands of customers
* Embrace our open-source culture and contribute to other projects that may not directly fall within your team’s scope
* Build, operate, and maintain critical systems, owning the reliability, performance, and availability
* Be a part of your team’s follow-the-sun on-call rotations and take ownership of the services you’re running
* Support other team members, participate in design discussions and collaborate with the team
* Learn new skills by gaining a deeper understanding of our cloud product and our customers and getting to know the codebase of a large distributed system


 As we are remote-first and our engineering organization is largely remote, we provide guidance and meet regularly using video calls, so an independent attitude and good communication skills are a must.
   

  

**What Makes You a Great Fit**
**You are a motivated self starter with a bias towards action. You are customer focused. We build everything with our users in mind. You have a passion for building intuitive products that fit customers’ needs. You have good time management skills, which you leverage to work on the right things at the right time.**
* Pragmatism: You have a bias towards action, taking direction and building a plan of action to analyze, design, and build modular solutions, deliver MVPs, gather data and feedback and then progress iteratively
* Collaboration and communication: The smallest unit we have is a squad. You’ll be working with your teammates in a fully remote setup. Good communication and time management skills are a must
* AI: some experience using LLMs for day to day coding tasks and understanding a codebase.
* Experience with at least one programming language. We use Go, but if you have familiarity with Python, C, C++, Rust or similar then that translates well
* Some experience with delivering projects as a member of a larger team. Your experience includes gathering requirements and brainstorming ideas, all the way to shipping features to the customer’s hands.
* Some experience with developing software that runs in the Cloud or some experience with systems engineering
* Some experience with being on-call and following the DevOps model
* Experience writing clean, robust, and performant software that is easily maintained by others
* Some familiarity with observability systems, know when to use metrics, logs, traces, to debug a problem.


**Bonus Points For**
* Experience working with Kubernetes
* Experience working with queue systems, e.g. the Kafka protocol
* Been a user of Grafana and Prometheus in operational roles (including on-call for your team at a previous employer or just using these tools on hobby/homelab projects)
* Exposure to microservices architecture and distributed systems, or a desire to learn
* Familiarity with the concept of infrastructure as code


 In Sweden, the compensation range for this role is SEK 609,985 - SEK 762,481. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed throughout the interview process. All of our roles include Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), giving every team member ownership in Grafana Labs' success. We believe in shared outcomes—RSUs help us stay aligned and invested as we scale globally.
   

  

* Compensation ranges are country specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.


**Why You’ll Thrive At Grafana Labs**
* 100% Remote, Global Culture - As a remote-only company, we bring together talent from around the world, united by a culture of collaboration and shared purpose.
* Scaling Organization – Tackle meaningful work in a high-growth, ever-evolving environment.
* Transparent Communication – Expect open decision-making and regular company-wide updates.
* Innovation-Driven – Autonomy and support to ship great work and try new things.
* Open Source Roots – Built on community-driven values that shape how we work.
* Empowered Teams – High trust, low ego culture that values outcomes over optics.
* Career Growth Pathways – Defined opportunities to grow and develop your career.
* Approachable Leadership – Transparent execs who are involved, visible, and human.
* Passionate People – Join a team of smart, supportive folks who care deeply about what they do.
* In-Person onboarding - We want you to thrive from day 1 with your fellow new ‘Grafanistas’ to learn all about what we do and how we do it.
* Balance is Key - We operate a global annual leave policy of 30 days per annum. 3 days of your annual leave entitlement are reserved for Grafana Shutdown Days to allow the team to really disconnect. \*We will comply with local legislation where applicable.


**Equal Opportunity Employer:** 
 We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.
   

  

*Grafana Labs may utilize AI tools in its recruitment process to assist in matching information provided in CVs to job postings. The recruitment team will continue to review inbound CVs manually to identify alignment with current openings.*
*For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy.*

title: Cloud Architect AWS - Migration Delivery
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens molnlösningar?
   

  

 Du blir en del av Capgeminis Cloud & Infrastructure Services (CIS)-enhet med fokus på projekt- och konsulttjänster i Norden. Vårt mål är att erbjuda kunder helhetslösningar inom Cloud och vi erbjuder en mängd olika tjänster till våra kunder, från strategisk rådgivning till projektgenomförande.
   

  

*I denna roll kommer du ha en nyckelroll i att:*
* Leda vår kund genom mainframe moderniseringsinitiativ
* Driva komplexa migreringsprojekt
* Samarbeta med intressenter för att samla in krav och föreslå effektiva migrationsstrategier
* Agera som en betrodd rådgivare till kunder gällande branschtrender och ny teknik
* Dela kunskap inom organisationen genom mentorskap, utbildning och skapande av återanvändbara artefakter


**Din Profil**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av molnarkitektur och implementering
* Praktisk teknisk erfarenhet av mainframe, non-x86 legacy system och av teknologier som COBOL, JCL, CICS, DB2 för z/OS, Assembler, PL/I, Java, Rexx, flat/sequential files, GDGs och VSAM
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av en teknisk roll med att migrera workloads från mainframe och non-x86 legacy systems till distribuerade x86 infrastrukturer antingen on-prem eller till cloud lösning.
* God erfarenhet av att integrera mainframe och non-x86 legacy system med distribuerade Linux- eller Windows-baserade x86-servrar
* Flytande i Svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


 Önskvärda kvalifikationer:
   

  

* AWS-certifieringar på associate- eller professionell nivå (t.ex. Solutions Architect Associate eller Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) är meriterande
* Erfarenhet av att leda kunder i initiativ för modernisering av mainframe och legacy system
* Erfarenhet av verktyg och metoder som används för att migrera mainframe workloads via hårdvaru-/mellanvaruemulering, automatiserad kodkonvertering, and re-platforming.
* Erfarenhet av att analysera och implementera lokala on-prem mainframes applikationer och datalager för modernisering av workloads


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:**
* Konkurrenskraftig lön, förmånliga tjänstepensioner och kollektivavtal som ger trygghet
* Fokus på din hälsa och ditt välmående, med initiativ för att skapa balans mellan jobb och fritid
* En arbetsmiljö med kollegor som stöttar och inspirerar varandra, och chefer som har ditt bästa i fokus
* Brett utbud av karriärmöjligheter och tillgång till Capgeminis stora utbildningskatalog, särskilt inom den senaste teknologin för t.ex. cloud och generativ AI
* En företagskultur där mångfald och inkludering värdesätts högt


**Ansökan**
*I denna rekrytering hanterar vi ansökningar löpande. Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Jessica Fogelsjöö, Jessica.fogelsjoo@capgemini.com.*
 Till denna roll söker vi medarbetare för säkerhetsklassat uppdrag placerad hos kund.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
You know that bit where every company says they’re
 *“changing the world”* 
 ? Yeah, it can feel a little forced. But we like to think our story actually has some realness to it.
 



  





 Our story begins with Shadi Bitar and Ninos Malki, who came to Sweden from Syria as kids and discovered that books could be a bridge – helping them learn the language, understand the culture, and explore new worlds.
 



  





 A thought emerged,
 *what if everyone could have that?* 
 And just like that, Nextory was born – your all-access pass to read, listen, and discover new perspectives without limits.
 



  





 And now, we’re searching for an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 who’s ready to lead the way. Turning ideas into experiences that inspire people to start their reading journey with us.
 



  





**Let us tell you about the role 📚** 




 As an Engineering Manager at Nextory, you’ll lead our Join Team – the talented group shaping the web experience at the very beginning of the customer journey with us. You’ll play a key role in inspiring potential readers to take their first step into the world of Nextory, combining technical leadership with people development to create seamless, engaging and high-performing digital experiences.
 



 Your work will include:
 


* Managing and empowering a team of six engineers to grow, collaborate, and deliver impact.
* Ensuring technical excellence and delivery quality in close collaboration with product and design.
* Driving transparency, collaboration, and innovation across teams.



  





**The main character we’re looking for 👀** 




 You have a solid background as a software engineer and several years of experience leading developers in a fast-moving digital environment. You take pride in building teams that consistently deliver results, and have fun doing it. We believe you thrive on creating an environment where people grow, perform at their best and turn great ideas into measurable results.
 



  





 We believe you:
 


* Bring experience from full-stack environments, with a true passion for frontend development.
* Feel confident working with JavaScript and TypeScript with a Java backend.
* Understand how to build high-performing web applications, CI/CD pipelines and smart SEO practices
* Have a track record of improving customer onboarding journeys and turning insights into great user experiences.



  





**The Nextory way of working 🏠** 




 At Nextory, we believe a strong and inclusive culture is key to our success – and that culture flourishes when we meet and collaborate in person as much as possible. That’s why we spend the majority of the working time at our beautiful office!
 



  





 We are based in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in Paris and Bangalore. Our hybrid work policy includes four days in the office and Wednesdays as a work-from-home day.
 



  





**Your next story starts here** 




 We look forward to your application 💫. Applications are reviewed continuously and if you have any questions about the role, please contact erika.thorslund@nextory.com
 



*Please note that we do not offer relocation and that a six-month probationary period applies.*

title: Säkerhetsanalytiker
description:
Byggföretagen arbetar för en attraktiv, sund och säker bygg- och anläggningsbransch där företagen konkurrerar på schyssta villkor. Nu söker vi dig som har ett stort intresse för byggbranschen och erfarenhet av säkerhetsfrågor!
 



**Om jobbet** 




 Våra medlemsföretag är organiserade i lokala byggföreningar som i sin tur tillhör fem geografiska regioner. Utöver regionerna har Byggföretagen ett kansli i Stockholm med experter och stödfunktioner som stöttar medarbetare och medlemsföretag nationellt.
 




 I rollen som säkerhetsanalytiker fokuserar du på att identifiera risker kopplade till oseriösa aktörer, organiserad brottslighet och andra säkerhetshot som påverkar bygg- och anläggningsbranschen. Du arbetar med fördjupade analyser av företag, företrädare och strukturer, och bidrar därigenom till att stärka sund konkurrens och motverka arbetslivskriminalitet.
 




 Du bidrar också aktivt till att utveckla Byggföretagens säkerhetsfunktion genom att ta fram och förbättra processer och rutiner för att identifiera, rapportera och hantera potentiella säkerhetsrisker. Rollen innefattar även arbete med dokumentation, struktur, manualer och mallar. Som säkerhetsanalytiker fungerar du dessutom som rådgivare och bollplank i säkerhetsfrågor, både internt och gentemot våra medlemsföretag.
 



 Du kommer att tillhöra kansliet och enheten
 
 Säkerhet och medlemsuppföljning som består av fem personer.
 




**Din profil** 




 Vi ser att du har några års erfarenhet från liknande roller inom myndighet, större organisation eller säkerhetsbolag. Du har arbetat med utredningar och riskbedömningar och har ett strukturerat arbetssätt. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av omvärldsbevakning, analys eller informationssäkerhet. Har du dessutom kunskap om bygg- och anläggningsbranschen – dess aktörer, risker och sårbarheter – är det ett plus.
 



 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha god samarbetsförmåga och vara prestigelös, metodisk och analytisk med ett skarpt öga för detaljer. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och relevanta erfarenheter från tidigare uppdrag.
 



 Som blivande medarbetare är det också viktigt att du kan identifiera dig med organisationens värdeord glädje, engagemang och professionalism. Läs gärna mer om vår kultur och våra värderingar här.
 



**Vi erbjuder** 




 På Byggföretagen kommer du till en stimulerande och utvecklande arbetsplats i en serviceinriktad miljö med god teamkänsla. Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i Näringslivets Hus på Storgatan 19 i Stockholm.
 



 Vi tillämpar förtroendearbetstid, erbjuder friskvårdsbidrag, arbetstidsförkortning, sjukvårdsförsäkring samt gruppförsäkring. Vi har en distansarbetespolicy som innebär att du i överenskommelse med chef har möjlighet att arbeta på distans i viss utsträckning.
 



 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning och i övriga frågor gäller tjänstemannaavtalet mellan Byggföretagen och Ledarna, Sveriges Ingenjörer, Unionen.
 



**Din ansökan** 




 Låter det här som jobbet för dig? Skicka då din ansökan till oss senast den 8 mars 2026. Vi arbetar med löpande urval så tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatumet.

title: LVDS Expert
description:
**Professional Galaxy** 
 is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise in IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.
   

  

 Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.
   

  

 Feel free to apply today, selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 Professional Galaxy is looking for a
 **LVDS Expert** 
 on behalf of our client.
   

  

 We are looking for a lead developer in leading us towards a much more compliant product strategy towards the LVDS (low voltage directive). low volume production line.
   

  

 We require a person with deap knowledge in LDVS and its harmonizing standards. and which does apply to our case. You will be considered as an LVDS EXPERT
   

  

 Both process wise and activity working with implementing a great WoW to achieve a improved compliance.
   

  

 Can be parttime and fulltime, depending on need, the assignment is to go through our current products and improve our WoW but also write some documentation how to coupe with the Demands.
   

  

**Extra merit:**
* EMC and Grounding strategy for Cabinets and mechatronical products.
* personal Safety.


 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

**Other Information :**
**Start Date :** 
 2026-03-02
   

  

**End Date :** 
 2026-05-31
   

  

**Application Deadline** 
 : 2026-02-19
   

  

**Work Model :** 
 On-site
   

  

 Please apply directly through our system with:
   

  

* Your updated CV
* Availability to start the assignment


 In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.

title: Engineering Lead - Remote Development Team
description:
We are super excited to announce that Johan, Joakim, Gabriel and Victor are looking to welcome their next colleague to Voyados Engineering team who will take technical ownership of a remote development team in India.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Engineering Lead, you’ll provide hands-on technical leadership for a distributed development team, with a strong focus on architecture, quality, delivery, and coaching. While this is not a role where you’ll code every day, you’ll stay close to the code — guiding technical decisions, reviewing solutions, and ensuring long-term scalability and performance.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with Product Managers, Engineering leadership, and stakeholders to translate customer and business needs into robust, observable, cloud-native solutions, while also helping the team grow through mentorship, structure, and clear technical direction.
   

  

 The team contributes to several strategically important areas of the Voyado platform, including integrations, onsite messaging, e-commerce integrations, lead ads, and Ratings & Reviews. You’ll also collaborate closely with initiatives around platforms such as BigCommerce, Centra, Shopify, Meta, TikTok, Pinterest, Snapchat and Shopware, acting as a technical bridge between Product and Engineering. This role includes close collaboration with colleagues in Stockholm as well as a remote development team based in India, with onsite visits approximately twice per year.
   

  

* Taking Technical onwership of systems and delivery for a remote revelopment team by leadning technical discussions, code reviews and architectural decisions.
* Coaching and mentoring engineers
* Identifying and addressing performance, scalability and reliability challenges.
* Driving thoughtful AI adoption across development and delivery


 So, who are you?
   

  

 You’re an experienced engineer and technical leader who enjoys guiding others, solving complex problems, and thinking long-term. You care deeply about quality, clarity, and collaboration — and you enjoy working in environments where technology, product, and people come together.
   

  

 We believe you bring:
   

  

* Broad and deep experience in software development with the ability to read and review code in C#, JavaScript and Typescript.
* Hands on experience with AWS.
* Experience leading and coaching remote development teams in India.
* Knowledge about AI supported workflows
* Excellent communication skills.


 What's in it for you?
   

  

 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and some examples of what we can offer you are:
   

  

* An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
* Summits where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth and learning in a dynamic and supportive environment.
* Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture, we value engagement over hours worked.
* An office-first but flexible hybrid working policy.


 Some of our benefits:
   

  

* 30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
* Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
* Breakfast buffet on Fridays
* Inhouse gym only for Voyadoers
* A generous gadget-and-phone package (your choice!)
* 5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance
* Parental leave top-up additional support for new parents
* A wellness hour you can use every week


**About Voyado**
 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, Voyado makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.
   

  

 We are now a company of 350+ colleagues on an exciting journey and have recently established a presence in new markets to strengthen our position in Europe. If you are ready for your next adventure and want to join our team on our expansion throughout Europe and have an interest in customer care, e-commerce, retail, and tech - let's get in touch!
   

  

**Be yourself 🏳️‍🌈**
 At Voyado, we believe in gender equality. We are proud sponsors of Womengineer as well as Tjejer Kodar! Read more about Tjejer Kodar & Voyado here
   

  

  

  

 Equality is not only about gender but also about making everyone feel welcome and heard in a multicultural and diverse environment. We at Voyado strive to make everyone feel like they can bring their true self to work every day. Gender-equal and diverse teams have more perspectives on life and bring different ideas to the table which in the end leads not only to making a better working environment but also a better product.
   

  

 Ready to find out more?
   

  

 Lovely! 🎉
   

  

*Before one applies it can always feel like you need a better resume, more polish, or just another year of experience, but we say if you think this sounds like a place where you can shine don't hesitate to send in your resume!*
**Making it personal with AI**
 We truly believe you’ll position yourself best for success in the interview process by being yourself with support from AI where it makes sense, later in the process you will even be expected to use AI. But at the end of the day, what matters is meeting you, the person behind the application.
   

  

 There is no such thing as a perfect candidate; we’re all human so please, bring your authentic self! Don’t let AI over polish your CV or answers to the point where we can’t hear your real voice because that’s what we care about the most.
   

  

*Note: As of right now we are unable to proceed with applicants outside of the EU, and a requirement of eligibility to work at Voyado is the right to work in the EU without limitations. Needless to say, this is something we are actively working on to be able to onboard colleagues from all over the world.*
 Voyado is the customer experience platform made for retail. We help brands turn every interaction—from first click to repeat purchase—into lasting loyalty.
   

  

 With AI-powered tools for search, personalization, marketing, and loyalty, we make it easy for retailers to grow and connect with customers in smarter ways.
   

  

 Loved by 400+ brands, Voyado is on a mission to become Europe’s most beloved retail companion.

title: Key Account Manager
description:
Vill du arbeta som strategisk partner i en organisation som är viktig för att samhället ska fungera? Vi söker en Key Account Manager/Kundansvarig som drivs av att utveckla starka relationer och driva samarbeten som gör verklig skillnad. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Skatteverkets it-avdelning levererar it-tjänster till flera myndigheter utöver Skatteverket. Det kan vara it-tjänster inom drift, infrastruktur och it-arbetsplats men även applikationsutveckling och förvaltning. Samverkan och partnerskap är nyckelord i detta uppdrag då drivkraften ligger i att tillsammans öka nyttan för den specifika myndigheten men även för samhället i stort.
   

  

 Sektionen du kommer tillhöra är under uppbyggnad och består av flera kundansvariga (KAM) som tillsammans har till uppgift att utveckla förmågan att leverera till andra myndigheter. Som kundansvarig har du hand om kontakterna med de anslutna myndigheter som it-avdelningen levererar till. Du har till uppgift att utveckla och upprätthålla en god och förtroendeingivande relation, är lyhörd och fångar upp de behov och utmaningar som den anslutna myndigheten har, på kort såväl som på lång sikt. I rollen är du också den anslutna myndighetens representant på Skatteverkets it-avdelning, där du utvecklar ett bra kontaktnät för att säkerställa att nya behov, frågor, eskaleringar m.m. tas om hand.
   

  

 Rollen innebär att du leder samverkan på både strategisk och taktisk nivå. Du säkerställer att den anslutna myndigheten och Skatteverkets it-avdelning vet vad de har att förhålla sig till i den överenskommelse som tecknats mellan myndigheterna för samverkan och leverans av it-tjänster. Du agerar om det finns behov av tolkningar eller om problem uppstår. Du ansvarar även för de ekonomiska aspekterna som budget, prognoser, uppföljning och fakturering i samverkan med den anslutna myndigheten.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Du har kunniga kollegor som du utbyter erfarenheter med och du kan utveckla både bredd och spets hos oss. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att delvis arbeta hemifrån. Du får en friskvårdstimme i veckan och friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Skatteverkets it-avdelning arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande arbetsplats som präglas av jämställdhet och mångfald där alla medarbetare får lika möjligheter att bidra och utvecklas. Läs mer på Jobba med it hos oss.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha förmågan att skapa goda och långsiktiga relationer där du har ett bra bemötande gentemot såväl våra kunder som dina kollegor
* ha förmågan att självständigt planera och driva ditt arbete framåt för att nå resultat
* ha en mycket god analytisk förmåga, vilket bland annat innebär att du fattar välgrundade beslut utifrån de fakta du tagit reda på inför lösningen av en uppgift
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga, se mönster och kunna göra avgränsningar
* vara mål- och resultatorienterad där du bidrar till att syftet med verksamheten uppnås
* ha en god kommunikationsförmåga i svenska, vilket innebär att du uttrycker dig på ett enkelt, tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt i både tal och skrift.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom it, alternativt flerårig och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom it-området
* flerårig, aktuell och relevant erfarenhet som Key Account Manager, kundansvarig eller annan liknande roll inom it-området som arbetsgivaren bedömer som relevant
* flerårig, aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med drift, infrastruktur och applikationsförvaltning


 Det är önskvärt om du har aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av liknande arbete på stor komplex organisation och/eller aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att ha haft säljaransvar inom it.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/979 | Kontakt: Caroline Törnkvist (HR-specialist rekrytering) caroline.tornkvist@skatteverket.se, Annica Oreland (Rekryterande chef) annica.oreland@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2026-01-21 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-02-11

title: Digital Marketing Executive
description:
**At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it.** 




 FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field.
 



**Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?** 




  





 We are seeking a pro-active and detail-oriented Digital Marketing Executive to work closely with the Digital Marketing Manager for {country} in delivering and optimising integrated digital marketing campaigns. This role plays a key part in supporting the planning, execution, and performance analysis of digital initiatives across multiple channels, ensuring brand consistency, audience engagement, and measurable growth. The successful candidate will be hands-on, data-driven, and eager to collaborate while contributing ideas that help drive continuous improvement. The role consists of responsibilities within the following areas:
 



  





**Campaign Management:** 



* Collaborate closely with the Digital Marketing Manager to manage and maintain a marketing project planner, ensuring campaign activity is effectively scheduled, prioritised, and aligned with broader commercial objectives.
* Plan, coordinate, and assist agency with integrated multi-channel marketing campaigns across key digital platforms, including PPC, SEO, social media, affiliate marketing, Pops, Mobile, Programmatic Display, and YouTube.
* Assist with preparing and delivering Growth OS campaign briefs to external partners, and internal briefs to FDJ stakeholders, ensuring clarity in objectives, timelines, and deliverables across channel/s in question.
* Collaborate with the CRM team, dovetailing acquisition and demonstrating awareness of tailored lifecycle marketing.
* Consult with agency on performance optimisation of paid media campaigns, ensuring campaigns are cost-effective, ROI-focused, and aligned with acquisition plans.



  





**Bonus and user testing:** 



* Work with key market stakeholders across product, CRM, and media teams to identify opportunities for improving digital user journeys and increasing conversion rates across acquisition funnels and landing experiences.
* Contribute to testing and optimisation strategies aimed at increasing ROI from digital campaigns, including A/B testing of creative, CTAs, and campaign structure.
* Contribute to the oversight and refinement of acquisition bonus strategies across all digital channels, working to maximise conversion rates while maintaining profitability and compliance.
* Identify suspicious activity or patterns linked to bonus abuse and assist in the development of preventative measures, supporting a sustainable acquisition model.



  





**Compliance & Responsible Gambling:** 



* Collaborate with digital and compliance teams to help ensure all marketing activity and customer-facing content remains within the regulatory framework defined by {country} Gambling Commission.
* Collaborate with compliance and legal teams to ensure that all marketing collateral and promotions are fully aligned with marketing standards and policies.
* Monitor the correct use of terms and conditions, responsible gambling messaging, and age restrictions across campaigns and digital platforms, ensuring messaging remains ethical and transparent.
* Assist stakeholders in routine compliance checks and monitoring processes across digital campaigns to uphold responsible gambling practices and brand integrity.



  





**Content & Creative Coordination:** 



* Brief internal creative teams on campaign requirements including AAMP, self-serve, other static and video assets, landing page content, digital banners, and promotional materials.
* Review and refine creative outputs to ensure high-quality design, compelling messaging, and brand consistency across all customer touchpoints.
* Ensure all marketing communications adhere to regulatory frameworks



  





**Reporting & Analysis:** 



* Highlight actionable insights based on campaign and channel performance, using internal tools and analytics teams to help guide future marketing decisions.
* Support the delivery of regular cross-channel performance reporting to inform strategic direction and ensure alignment with broader marketing goals.



  





**General:** 



* Stay informed on the latest digital marketing technologies, tools, and trends within the iGaming and broader online entertainment industries.
* Proactively identify opportunities to apply innovative marketing practices and emerging technologies to enhance campaign performance, audience targeting, and regulatory compliance.

title: Senior Security Engineer
description:
**Build something monumental for Healthcare!**
 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
   

  

 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 You’re the kind of person who can’t help but poke at systems, curious about how they work, how they break, and how they can be made stronger. At previous jobs, you were the one who opened up the hood, explored the edges, and asked:
 *“How could someone bypass this?”* 
 and
 *“How do we fix it properly?”* 
 You enjoy the craft of building secure systems just as much as understanding how to exploit them.
   

  

 At Tandem, you’ll bring that mindset to help us build a secure, fast, and reliable foundation for AI-powered healthcare tools used across Europe. You’ll work hands-on across the stack: from application security and CI/CD pipelines to infrastructure hardening, penetration testing, and secure development practices. Your mission is simple but impactful: ensure Tandem can ship quickly and stay secure.
   

  

 This is a role for someone who wants to be right in the middle of the action - designing secure architectures, breaking things safely, and helping developers stay productive without compromising safety. You will enable the business by proactively remove blockers. This is what makes us fast. You’ll collaborate closely with the Head of Security, engineering teams, and compliance to build security into everything we do.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Work hands-on to secure Tandem’s infrastructure, applications, and internal systems.
* Build and maintain secure-by-default practices across the software development lifecycle (SDLC).
* Implement and operate static and dynamic code analysis, dependency scanning, and secure CI/CD tooling.
* Conduct or lead penetration testing, threat modelling, and vulnerability assessments.
* Support secure architecture design across engineering, including container orchestration, IAM, networking, and secrets management.
* Help ensure Tandem can deliver code quickly while maintaining a strong security posture.
* Work closely with developers, pairing, reviewing, and advising to help them ship secure, high-quality code efficiently.
* Participate in incident detection, response, and security reviews.
* Collaborate with the Head of Security on long-term strategy, audits, and certifications (ISO 27001, MDR, GDPR).


**What You Bring**
* Strong hands-on experience in security engineering, application security, or infrastructure security.
* Experience with penetration testing, exploitation techniques, or red-teaming (formal or self-taught).
* Familiarity with secure CI/CD, code analysis tools (SAST/DAST), dependency scanning, and vulnerability management.
* Strong understanding of authentication, identity, secrets management, and secure networking fundamentals.
* Ability to collaborate deeply with developers and make security a natural part of engineering workflow.
* Pragmatic mindset - you know how to balance security and speed in a fast-moving environment.
* Curiosity, creativity, and a genuine interest in how systems work (and how they can break).


**Bonus Points**
* Experience with container orchestration (Kubernetes, ECS, Nomad)
* Hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure security (AWS/GCP/Azure)
* Experience contributing to ISO 27001 or SOC 2 audits
* Background in software development (Python, Go, TypeScript)
* Experience in threat modelling or vulnerability research
* Worked in a regulated or compliance-heavy environment (healthcare, fintech, govtech)


**Culture at Tandem**
 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
   

  

 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
   

  

 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.
   

  

*Tandem handles sensitive patient data and will conduct a background check before hiring any candidate.*

title: Motion Designer
description:
**Who We Are**
 We’re Valtech RADON, an award-winning hybrid creative agency – part of the Valtech family. If you are interested in joining our team, you are welcome to apply with your resume.
   

  

 At Valtech RADON, we combine creative, strategy, craft, and media to build remarkable brands across all touchpoints. We work with some of the world’s most recognisable brands – including Pantene, Netflix, Ericsson, Husqvarna, and Nordic brands like RFSU, Halebop, and Byggmax.
   

  

 We’re the second home to 50+ people spanning 10+ nationalities (and many more backgrounds, experiences, and places we've called home). Our office is in Stockholm, Sweden, but we work with brands worldwide and welcome applicants from all over the world.
   

  

**The role**
 Are you obsessed with 2D and 3D motion? Do you close your eyes at night to visions of perfect transitions and warping digital surrealism? Us too. We’re looking for a Motion Designer to join our team of animation junkies and help us to raise heartbeats with motion, emotion, and storytelling. This is a creative-first role where you’ll work closely with other motion designers, art directors, film directors, editors, and other creatives across Radon to shape ideas into clear, thumb-stopping visual candy.
   

  

 What do we want from you? Captivating animation in both 2D and 3D, a good eye for design, and a curiosity for defining how we use the future tools of the trade. As Motion Designer you'll be a sparring partner to the Creative Department to challenge our thinking and deliver best-in-class digital experiences for our clients.
   

  

 AI tools are a natural part of the design landscape, and while they’re not the core of this role, you’re curious and open to using them where they add value.
   

  

 In this mid-level role you’ll play a crucial part in continuously pushing the quality of our output. You’ll challenge briefs, refine ideas, and help raise the bar for visual craft across everything we do.
