title: Senior R&D Engineer Mechatronics
description:
*Hiab is the pioneer in smart and sustainable on road load handling solutions. We believe in more than just work — we believe in making a difference for our customers to building a better tomorrow.*

  

Say Hi! to your next challenge — explore the opportunity and apply below!

**Your mission**
----------------

  


We are seeking a Senior R&D Engineer Mechatronics to join our team in Vallentuna. This role is central to the mechanical design and development of our electronics product portfolio, which includes sensors, remote controllers, and other electronic devices.

  



In this dynamic and multidisciplinary environment, you will collaborate closely with the Electronics, Software, and Hydraulics departments. This position offers the opportunity to be involved in the full development lifecycle, contributing both to new product development and the initial stages of serial production. A key part of your responsibility will be to help define and develop the necessary manufacturing and testing systems/machines required for serial production.

  



The ideal candidate will have prior experience spanning the entire product development chain, from initial concept and prototype through to the final, finished product.

**Key responsibilities**
------------------------

  

* Project manager of smaller development projects of new products and production equipment
* Mechanical design of new products or life care of existent products mainly related to electronics devices, like sensors, remote controllers and other electronic equipment.
* Mechanical design of production and test systems
* Documentation, preparation of drawings, manuals and “data sheets” for new products
* Collaborate and harmonise processes and procedure with Product Designer in Hydraulics
**What we are looking for**
---------------------------

  

* B.Sc. or M.Sc. within Mechatronics, Mechanics, Material Science, Polymer Technology or equivalent
* 8+ years of experience in similar field
* Swedish and English (both at good level of spoken and written)
* Previous experience from plastic construction, preferably for products with higher environmental requirements (e.g. the automotive industry)
* Material and Manufacturing: Extensive knowledge of plastic materials, proficiency in manufacturing processes like vacuum forming and 2K injection molding, and familiarity with surface treatments (Electrical Discharge Machining, etching) and patterning
* Calculation, Joining and Analysis of plastic material: Strength calculation and skill in joining methods (welding, riveting), form filling and warping analysis
* Verification/measurement against requirements and quality assurance
* Freeform modeling and additive manufacturing
* Worked in the SolidWorks environment and their PDM
* Experience with MCAD-ECAD collaboration, preferably digital
* Worked on streamlining product structures at the drawing level such as configurations or similar
* Windchill PDM experiences
* Jira platform for information exchange and documentation
**What we offer**
-----------------

  


As part of a global organization, you will gain access to an extensive network and exciting development projects. At the same time, we value personal development and the close collaboration that characterizes our local operations. Cooperation, commitment, quality, and order are the guiding principles we work by. We are constantly working to maintain a pleasant and enjoyable work environment for our employees with opportunities to grow in your role and develop it further.

  

Place of Work and travels:


*Place of work: Vallentuna (Stockholm)*  

*Visits to other sites in Sweden, upon project needs.*  

*Estimated travel: 2-4 times per year.*

**Ready to apply?**
-------------------

  


If you are excited about this opportunity, please submit your application/CV in English. We look forward to hearing from you!

 **We Are Hiab**  

Hiab (Nasdaq Helsinki: HIAB) is a leading provider of smart and sustainable on road load-handling solutions, committed to delivering the best customer experience every day with the most engaged people and partners. As the industry pioneer, Hiab continues to make on road load-handling smarter, safer and more sustainable to build a better tomorrow.


*www.hiabgroup.com*

title: Engineering Manager
description:
You know that bit where every company says they’re “changing the world”? Yeah, it can feel a little forced. But we like to think our story actually has some realness to it.
  
Our story begins with Shadi Bitar and Ninos Malki, who came to Sweden from Syria as kids and discovered that books could be a bridge – helping them learn the language, understand the culture, and explore new worlds.
  
A thought emerged, what if everyone could have that? And just like that, Nextory was born – your all-access pass to read, listen, and discover new perspectives without limits.
  
And now, we’re searching for an Engineering Manager who’s ready to lead the way. Turning ideas into experiences that inspire people to start their reading journey with us.
  
Let us tell you about the role
  
As an Engineering Manager at Nextory, you’ll lead our Join Team – the talented group shaping the web experience at the very beginning of the customer journey with us. You’ll play a key role in inspiring potential readers to take their first step into the world of Nextory, combining technical leadership with people development to create seamless, engaging and high-performing digital experiences.
  
  

**Your work will include:**  

Managing and empowering a team of five engineers to grow, collaborate, and deliver impact.
  
  

Ensuring technical excellence and delivery quality in close collaboration with product and design.
  
  

Driving transparency, collaboration, and innovation across teams.
  
  

The main character we’re looking for
  
You have a solid background as a software engineer and several years of experience leading developers in a fast-moving digital environment. You take pride in building teams that consistently deliver results, and have fun doing it. We believe you thrive on creating an environment where people grow, perform at their best and turn great ideas into measurable results.
  
  

**We believe you:**  

Bring experience from full-stack environments, with a true passion for frontend development.
  
  

Feel confident working with JavaScript and TypeScript with a Java backend.
  
  

Understand how to build high-performing web applications, CI/CD pipelines and smart SEO practices
  
  

Have a track record of improving customer onboarding journeys and turning insights into great user experiences.
  
  

The Nextory way of working
  
At Nextory, we believe a strong and inclusive culture is key to our success – and that culture flourishes when we meet and collaborate in person as much as possible. That’s why we spend the majority of the working time at our beautiful office!
  
We are based in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in Paris and Bangalore. Our hybrid work policy includes four days in the office and Wednesdays as a work-from-home day.
  
Your next story starts here
  
We look forward to your application . Applications are reviewed continuously and if you have any questions about the role, please contact erika.thorslund@nextory.com
  
Please note that we do not offer relocation and that a six-month probationary period applies.

title: Systemsamordnare till komplexa infrastrukturprojekt
description:
*Vill du arbeta* *med* *tekniska frågeställningar i komplexa* *infrastrukturprojekt**och**bidra till en bra upplevel**se för**de**resenärer* *som reser* *med SL trafiken**i Stockholm* *varje dag**? Som systemsamordnare kommer du* *arbeta i* *utvecklings**projekt* *med fokus på Systems* *Engineering**, där struktur, samordning och hantering av tekniska beroenden är centrala.*

**Om rollen**
-------------


Som systemsamordnare har du ansvaret för helhetssynen i tekniska utvecklingsprojekt som kan innehålla både spåranläggningar, depåer, signalsystem, elkraftssystem, resenärsmiljöer samt nya tåg och fartyg. Rollen är inriktad på Systems Engineering och innebär att säkerställa att tekniska lösningar inom flera olika discipliner utvecklas, samordnas och förvaltas i enlighet med gemensamma krav, metoder och processer.


Du kommer arbeta tvärfunktionellt i projektorganisationen och bidra till att tekniska beslut fattas på ett strukturerat, spårbart och långsiktigt hållbart sätt. Avdelningen för investeringsprojekt ansvarar för att bygga ut och förnya infrastrukturen för SL-trafiken i Stockholm. Det är komplexa projekt med många tekniska beroenden.

**Några exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**

* Ta fram och sammanställa systemdefinitioner, systembeskrivningar och tekniska underlag
* Identifiera och dokumentera tekniska beroenden, gränssnitt och risker mellan delsystem
* Medverka i kravarbete, inklusive kravnedbrytning, ändringshantering och uppföljning
* Granska tekniska leveranser mot ställda krav och beslutande arkitekturprinciper
* Stödja projektledare och tekniska specialister i systemfrågor genom hela projektets livscykel

**För att trivas och lyckas i rollen behöver du:**

Du har ett tydligt tekniskt fokus och arbetar strukturerat med komplexa systemfrågor. Du är van att analysera helheter, hantera beroenden och arbeta metodiskt i miljöer där flera tekniska discipliner möts.


Du kommunicerar sakligt och tydligt, både i tekniska dialoger och när du presenterar systemlösningar i större sammanhang. Rollen kräver att du kan utrycka dig obehindrat på svenska i både tal och skrift.

**Krav:**

* Några års erfarenhet av tekniskt utvecklingsarbete relevant för kollektivtrafiksystem
* Erfarenhet av arbete med komplexa system som ex. infrastruktur, transportverksamhet, medicinteknik eller försvar
* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande kompetens via arbetslivserfarenhet

**Det är meriterande om du har:**

* Certifiering inom Systems Engineering eller motsvarande
* Arbetat i en koordinerande roll i en projektorganisation
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med förändringsledning
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat enligt standarden ISO/IEC 15288:2015 Systems and software engineering – System life cycle processes
* Kunskap inom kravhantering och ändringshantering av krav

**Om oss**
----------


Hos oss på trafikförvaltningen får du jobba med starka varumärken som SL, Waxholmsbolaget, Färdtjänst i Region Stockholm och Spårvägsmuseet.


Tillsammans ansvarar vi för halva Sveriges kollektivtrafik och vi har höga ambitioner. Vi utvecklar en av världens mest hållbara och attraktiva kollektivtrafik. Och vi jobbar dagligen med att minska vår miljöpåverkan, öka social hållbarhet och ansvarfullt förvalta våra gemensamma medel. Utan oss stannar Stockholm.

**Det här erbjuder vi dig**
---------------------------


På trafikförvaltningen har du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas för ett helt yrkesliv. Här kan du vara expert och fokusera på ditt sakområde. Samtidigt som du jobbar i ett lag och i en organisation med stor bredd. Det finns stora möjligheter att röra sig mellan olika roller och uppgifter. Du har utrymme att forma din egen karriärväg och stärka både din personliga och professionella utveckling i en spännande och varierad miljö!


Vi är en välkomnande och öppen arbetsplats där vi stöttar och hjälper varandra. Vi vet att nyckeln för att vi ska klara vårt uppdrag – är medarbetare som trivs, mår bra och kan utvecklas på jobbet. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid att säkerställa hållbarhet i vårt arbetssätt, bland annat genom att erbjuda flexibilitet i vardagen och hybridarbete när möjlighet finns.


Årligen erbjuds hälsoundersökning och friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr. Hälsospåret, vår friskvårdssatsning, innehåller en rad olika hälsofrämjande aktiviteter. SL-kort är en annan uppskattad förmån hos oss. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
------------------------------


Du ansöker med CV via vår hemsida, vi har inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökan via e-post. För att säkra objektiva bedömningar använder vi tester i samband med urval. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Niklas Eriksson, tfn 0707861519. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta rekryterare Sofia Åkerblom, tfn 0707872558.


Ansök redan i dag eftersom intervjuer kan ske löpande. Sista ansökningsdag är **4 mars**. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Grundutredning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan komma att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Vissa tjänster ställer krav på svenskt medborgarskap samt omfattas av en säkerhetsprövningsintervju med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).


Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas och eventuella arbetsprov kan bli aktuella för tjänsten.

**Webb och sociala medier**
---------------------------


För mer information om hur det är att jobba hos oss, besök vår karriärsida. Du hittar oss också på LinkedIn.


#LI-Hybrid


Vi är stolta samhällsutvecklare. Med kompetens och engagemang tar vi Stockholm och kollektivtrafiken framåt. Vi ansvarar för SL, Waxholmsbolaget, Färdtjänsten och Spårvägsmuseet och tillsammans utvecklar vi en trygg, attraktiv och tillgänglig kollektivtrafik för nära 900 000 resenärer. Följ med oss på resan!


Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm

title: Summer Intership- Software development for optical testing
description:
**Job descriptions may display in multiple languages****based on your language selection.**

**What we offer:**
------------------


At Magna, you can expect an engaging and dynamic environment where you can help to develop industry-leading automotive technologies. We invest in our employees, providing them with the support and resources they need to succeed. As a member of our global team, you can expect exciting, varied responsibilities as well as a wide range of development prospects. Because we believe that your career path should be as unique as you are.**Group Summary:**
------------------


Transforming mobility. Making automotive technology that is smarter, cleaner, safer and lighter. That’s what we’re passionate about at Magna Electronics, and we do it by creating world-class Electronic systems. We are a premier supplier for the global automotive industry with full capabilities in design, development, testing and manufacturing of complex Electronic systems. Our name stands for quality, environmental consciousness, and safety. Innovation is what drives us and we drive innovation. Dream big and create the future of mobility at Magna Electronics.**Job Responsibilities:**


Magna’s Optics‑team arbetar med att utveckla och testa optiska system för kamerabaserade produkter. En viktig del av vårt arbete är att utföra optiska tester, där mjukvara används för att styra testutrustning, samla in mätdata och analysera resultaten.


Vi använder främst egenutvecklad mjukvara och arbetar hela tiden med att förbättra kvaliteten, testtäckningen och strukturen i våra verktyg.


Som sommarpraktikant blir du en del av Optics‑teamet och hjälper till att utveckla och förbättra vår interna testmjukvara. Du kommer bland annat att:

* förbättra och strukturera befintlig testkod
* vara med och bygga upp en tidig test‑ och valideringspipeline, inklusive enhetstester
* bidra till beslut kring mjukvaruarkitektur i våra testverktyg
* samarbeta med optikingenjörer för att förstå hur mjukvara används i optiska mätningar
* lära dig grunderna i optisk testning och hur mätdata skapas och tolkas


Arbetet är både praktiskt och tekniskt, och har en direkt påverkan på hur tester genomförs i praktiken.

**Kvalifikationer**  

Vi söker dig som har en positiv inställning, tycker om att lära dig nya saker och tar dig an uppgifter med engagemang och ett öppet mindset. Du är proaktiv och lösningsorienterad, strukturerad och noggrann, och du tar ansvar för det du gör. Du trivs med att samarbeta och skapar enkelt goda relationer med kollegor och andra du möter i arbetet.


Vi ser gärna att du studerar mjukvaruteknik, datavetenskap, teknisk fysik eller ett liknande område och gillar att skriva tydlig och testbar kod.


För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:

* Goda kunskaper i objektorienterad programmering i MATLAB, Python eller liknande språk
* Erfarenhet av Git och GitHub
* Grundläggande förståelse för enhetstester, mjukvarustruktur och arkitektur
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och samarbeta med andra ingenjörer


Meriterande (men inte krav)

* Grundläggande kunskap om optik eller optiska system
* Läst kurser som signaler och system, Fourieranalys eller liknande
* Erfarenhet av camera systems, image processing, computer vision

**Ansökan och kontaktinformation**


Har du frågor om tjänsten? Vänligen kontakta Talent Acquisition Partner Per Lind på per.lind@magna.com eller Rekryterande chef Edvin Hansson, edvin.hansson@magna.com

**Sista ansökningsdatum**: 2026-03-15, Observera att vi tillämpar löpande urval, vilket innebär att tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.

**Anställningsform**: Visstidsanställning för sommaren (juni–augusti). Start- och slutdatum kan anpassas efter överenskommelse

**Awareness, Unity, Empowerment:**
----------------------------------


At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email or traditional mail to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

**AI-Assisted Screening Disclosure**


As part of our commitment to a fair, consistent, and efficient recruitment process, we may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to assist in the initial screening of applications submitted through our Workday system. These tools help identify qualifications and experience that align with the role requirements. Please note that AI is used solely to support our recruiters. Final decisions are always made by the hiring manager and the hiring team. Importantly, no applicant data is shared externally through these AI tools. All information remains securely within our systems and is handled in accordance with our privacy and data protection policies.

**Under conditions defined by applicable law, you may have the right to request an explanation of how AI is used to support decision-making.**


If you have any questions or concerns about this process, feel free to contact our Talent Attraction team.

**Worker Type:**


Fixed Term (Fixed Term)**Group:**


Magna Electronics

title: Application Engineer
description:
Aurobay develops and produces world-class hybrid engines and transmissions. With factories on two continents - Sweden and China - we're a pioneering global supplier of propulsion technology, development services and contract manufacturing. The Aurobay brand brings together over 9,000 dedicated and determined people that design, develop, and manufacture next-generation powertrain solutions for a global market.


Aurobay is part of HORSE Powertrain Limited, a global leader in powertrain solutions. The Group has 19,000 employees, 17 plants and 5 R&D centers across three continents. We partner with OEM customers around the world and offer innovative solutions that can cater to up to 80% of the growing hybrid and combustion powertrain market, enabling a faster transition toward cleaner mobility.


At Aurobay, we are committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and believe that different perspectives and experiences make for a stronger, more innovative company.

**Assignment description**


In this role, you will act as a Application Engineer, ensuring smooth operation, maintenance, and optimization of IT systems and applications within a dynamic automotive testing environment. Collaborating with cross-functional teams to address advanced technical challenges and bring forward innovative solutions

**Skill requirements**

**Knowledge & Experience:**

* Providing expert technical support and managing operating systems, including Windows 10, 11, and Windows/Linux Server.
* Monitoring performance using tools like Zabbix and log analytics tools, proactively identifying and resolving issues to ensure system reliability.
* Managing Group Policies, Azure infrastructure, and Microsoft 365 to support seamless operations across the organization.
* Troubleshooting and maintaining applications, as well as understanding networking fundamentals and backup solutions.
* Educating and supporting end-users to optimize the use of testbeds, vehicle testing systems, and other technical applications.
* Assisting in hardware setups and system integration in automotive testing environments.
* Hands-on experience (minimum 5 years) troubleshooting hardware and software systems in production environments.
* At least 3 years of experience in the automotive industry, ideally in testing environments or similar setups.
* Familiarity with applications like WSP (Comtest), AVL (Indicom, Concerto, Creta, etc.), ETAS INCA will be highly valued.

**Skills & Attributes:**

* Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, with a solution-driven mindset.
* Strong collaborative and communication skills to work effectively in a fast-moving, technical environment.
* Passion for advancing technologies and interest in automotive testing trends and hardware integration.
* Ability to stay updated on emerging trends in automotive testing equipment.

title: Product Manager
description:
### **About Magma Math**


Magma is one of the world’s fastest-growing and most celebrated EdTech companies, transforming math education through the power of AI. Our platform turns handwritten solutions into digital insights, empowering teachers to focus on creativity and deeper learning — while giving them real-time visibility into student progress.


The result? More inclusive, engaging, and effective math classrooms for all learners.


But we’re not just building better tools. We’re tackling one of the biggest challenges in global education: math underperformance. With 1 in 5 students globally struggling in math — a subject that forms the backbone of so many career paths — we believe the opportunity to improve outcomes at scale is massive.


We’re already the go-to solution in thousands of schools — and we’re just getting started. As we expand rapidly across the U.S. and Europe, we’re building a team as ambitious as our mission: to help millions of students unlock their full potential in math.

#### **The Role**


The Product & Tech team at Magma is divided into three core experiences: Teacher, Student and District. With a growing user base (and plenty of exciting problems to solve), we’re now hiring Product Managers to strengthen both the Teacher Experience team and the District Experience team.


In this role, you will work closely with a team of developers, QA and designers to plan, build and launch new features within one of these experiences. You will own a domain end-to-end - from figuring out what problem is worth solving, to shipping a solution, to making sure it actually creates value for students, teachers, districts and the business.‍

**Who you are and what you know**


To succeed in the role you need to:

* Be hands-ons and contribute across full product development phase; user research, design, implementation, testing. This is not a pure project manager role where you are only coordinating
* Be comfortable owning both business and tech outcomes
* Be curious and ready to learn a lot of new things


Your responsibilities will include:

* Leading a team of developers, QAs and designers
* Leading the development and implementation of a domain within Teacher or District Experience.
* Coordinating efforts across the product, tech, customer success and revenue teams.

**Requirements**

* Hungry to grow within Product Development and track record of ability to go deep/obsess over projects you've run
* Engineering degree (or equivalent) from top tier university
* Startup experience - you know what you are getting yourself into!
* Experience of fast paced and high performance environment

**Nice to have**

* Experience as software engineer, designer, product manager, data science
* Experience in edtech or education
* Portfolio of products you've built

#### **What we offer**

* Build and ship high touch products with positive impact million of users
* Be part of driving change in an industry
* Fantastic colleagues in a fun environment with great opportunities to learn
* Competitive remuneration & benefit package
* Annual company trip
* An opportunity to work on a meaningful mission and have an exceptional impact on education, society and how children learn math across the world  

‍

**Start**: As soon as possible

**Office location**:

**Our recruitment process (all in office):**


1st interview with Hiring Manager and Head of People


2nd interview with Hiring Manager and Magma member


3rd interview with Founders and Magma member

title: Creative Developers
description:
*MSAB is a global leader in digital forensic technology for mobile device examination and analysis. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions – for a safer world. A core value is to run an ethics-driven company with innovation and results. The sole focus of MSAB is on delivering high quality digital forensic solutions to collect, review, analyze and manage data. MSAB is a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defence Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption.*
 We love creating great code that matters - and the people who write it. We are always on the look-out for coders skilled in C++ or C# with innovative mindset.
   

  

 If you want to use your coding expertise and problem-solving mindset to make the world more transparent, safer, and more democratic? At MSAB, you can turn that ambition into reality.
   

  

 We’re a global leader in digital forensics, building advanced tools used worldwide to solve crimes, fight corruption, investigate fraud, and support justice. Here, your code has real-world impact.
   

  

**Possibilities**
 As a developer at MSAB, you’ll dive deep into complex and highly technical challenges - exactly the kind that motivate curious, inventive engineers.
   

  

**Your Work Might Involve**
* Extracting and decrypting data from mobile devices
* Writing decoders, parsers, and low-level implementations
* Reverse-engineering apps and making complex data structures readable
* Implementing efficient, high-performance code in C++
* Working close to hardware, embedded systems, Android, or iOS internals


 If that excites you - you’re exactly who we want to meet.
   

  

**Our Culture**
 Our culture is friendly, supportive, and built on shared learning and technical curiosity. You’ll thrive here if you enjoy autonomy, like exploring new ideas, and want to grow by stepping outside your comfort zone.
   

  

 There’s much more to tell you about our tech stack, vision, innovation and ways of working, and the opportunities ahead. But let’s save that for future conversations.
   

  

 Ready to build software that makes a real difference?
   

  

 Send your application today.
   

  

 For more information about MSAB, please visit: http://www.msab.com
   

  

 What we can offer
   

  

 Create a safer world with us!
   

  

 As one of the world’s leading digital forensics companies, MSAB leads the way in pioneering advancements that contribute to making our world safer.
   

  

 Your work at MSAB will bridge the gap between technology and justice. You will be inspired to go beyond your comfort zone, and you will deal with challenging and meaningful projects. When you join us, you become part of a global team that aspires to create a safer digital future, one breakthrough at a time.
   

  

 We can offer you an exciting work environment, where we value being innovative, acting ethically and delivering results in everything we do while our customers' needs are at the center. We are proud to be a fast-growing international company with more than 20+ nationalities and we work with things that really make a difference.
   

  

 Every day at MSAB is an opportunity to redefine the future of digital forensics.
   

  

 Are you up for the challenge?
   

  

 Department Development Locations Stockholm, Sweden Remote status Hybrid

title: Developer - AI Team
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization now includes around 200 highly skilled professionals.
   

  

 Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?
   

  

**About The Role**
*Join Our AI Team – Build Tech That Transforms Everyday Life!*
**Our Mission**
 We're on a bold journey to supercharge how the Odevo group companies operate by making artificial intelligence an integral part of how work gets done. As an AI Engineer, you’ll help create solutions that impact millions of homes and daily routines—making life smarter, easier, and more connected.
   

  

**What You’ll Work On**
 Our scope is broad and future-focused, giving you the chance to explore multiple areas of AI innovation:
   

  

* Intelligent Automation: Build systems that understand and process massive amounts of information—from text documents and spreadsheets to chat and email conversations from customer service.
* Agent Framework & Evals: Design and implement an agentic framework with robust evaluation pipelines, covering reliability, safety, and performance, so we can continuously measure, improve, and trust the behavior of our AI systems.
* Real Products, Not Just POCs: Ship and own real, production-grade AI products. You will be involved end to end, from prototype to deployment to ongoing maintenance, making sure what we build is used, loved, and delivering measurable value for users.


 In short: you’ll join a high-speed innovation track where your work shapes how we use AI moving forward.
   

  

**Your Role**
* Design and implement AI-powered solutions using cutting-edge generative AI and LLMs.
* Collaborate with engineers, designers, and product managers to turn ideas into impactful products.
* Stay ahead of the curve—experiment with the latest AI breakthroughs and bring them into production.
* Share knowledge and inspire other teams across the organization.


**Who You Are**
* A passionate software engineer with hands-on experience in generative AI.
* Skilled in Python (FastAPI) and React—or open to learning new tools for the right task.
* Experienced in building real-world applications for users.
* Curious, collaborative, and always exploring new tech developments.
* Fluent in Swedish and ready to demo your skills.


**What We Offer**
* A playground for innovation with the latest tech and tools.
* A culture that values creativity, ownership, and fun.
* Hybrid work setup in Stockholm with three days at the office—balance focus and collaboration.


 Ready to Shape the Future of AI?
   

  

 Apply now and let’s build something extraordinary together!

title: Junior Automated Tester
description:
We are leading specialists in television and video services, with a true passion for technology and innovation. We help organizations transform their television and video businesses to successfully meet the needs and expectations of today’s audiences.
   

  

 Our purpose is to drive the evolution of television and allow more people to benefit from the advantages and opportunities that technology brings to the way we consume video. We aim to provide the best information and entertainment video experience by partnering with telecom operators and media companies.
   

  

 Hello! 👋
   

  

 Are you passionate about technology and eager to develop your career in software testing and automation? 🎬💻
   

  

 Would you like to work in a highly technical environment where you can grow your skills in Linux, automation, performance testing, and networking?
   

  

 If you’re curious, analytical, and motivated to learn, we’d love to meet you! 🙌
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **Junior Automated Tester** 
 to join our team at
 **Edgeware (AgileTV Group)** 
 in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   

  

 📍
 **Location**
**Stockholm, Sweden** 
 – Hybrid work at our Edgeware offices.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Junior Automated Tester, you will work closely with QA engineers, developers, and system specialists. You’ll contribute to testing activities and progressively take on more responsibilities in automation and performance environments.
   

  

**Your Role Will Include**
 ✅ Assist in designing and maintaining automated test scripts in Linux‑based environments.
   

  

 ✅ Execute functional, regression, and performance tests under guidance.
   

  

 ✅ Collaborate with the QA and development teams to identify automation opportunities.
   

  

 ✅ Document test results, report defects, and follow up on fixes.
   

  

 ✅ Support integration of automated tests into CI pipelines (e.g., Jenkins).
   

  

 ✅ Help troubleshoot issues across software, hardware, and network environments.
   

  

 ✅ Participate in hardware‑related testing (servers, NICs, SSDs, memory, cabling).
   

  

 ✅ Work on networking‑related test scenarios (IPv4/IPv6, routing, VLANs, bonding).
   

  

 ✅ Contribute to continuous improvement of tools, processes, and QA methodology.
   

  

**Key Requirements (Junior Level)**
 You can be
 **recently graduated** 
 or have
 **limited experience** 
 , as long as you bring strong technical foundations and motivation to grow.
   

  

 🔹 Solid understanding of
 **Linux** 
 (must-have).
   

  

 🔹 Troubleshooting mindset and basic system diagnostic skills.
   

  

 🔹 Basic scripting knowledge (Python, Bash).
   

  

 🔹 Familiarity or interest in CI/CD tools (Jenkins, Git, GitHub).
   

  

 🔹 Interest in hardware architectures: CPU, memory DDR4/DDR5, SSD, NVMe, PCIe.
   

  

 🔹 Basic networking knowledge: IPv4/IPv6, routing, VLANs, bonding, netmasks.
   

  

 🔹 Curiosity about performance testing.
   

  

 🔹 Some exposure to programming (C, C++, or Golang is a plus).
   

  

 🔹 Interest in tools like Ansible (desirable but not required).
   

  

 🔹 Basic knowledge of server installation, disks, NICs, OS installation, wiring, etc.
   

  

 🔹
 **High English proficiency** 
 (international environment).
   

  

 No professional experience required — what matters most is
 **curiosity, technical aptitude, and willingness to learn** 
 .
   

  

**Who You Are**
 🕵️ Sharp‑eyed and detail‑oriented — you enjoy understanding how things work.
   

  

 🤝 Collaborative — you value teamwork and knowledge sharing.
   

  

 💡 Eager to learn — you want to grow in automation, systems, and performance testing.
   

  

 🔄 Adaptable — comfortable in dynamic, evolving environments.
   

  

 🚀 Tech‑driven — passionate about software, hardware, and problem‑solving.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* 💸 Flexible Compensation: Tailor your benefits, including gourmet vouchers, daycare, and transportation.
* ⌚ Flexible Hours: Work at your own pace and manage your schedule.
* 🏠Hybrid Work: Enjoy the convenience and comfort of working from home.
* 🎉 Birthday Off: Celebrate your special day with a day off!
* ☀️ Recharge Fridays: Enjoy a quarterly day off to recharge.
* 🌴 Extra Days Off: Celebrate your work anniversaries with additional time off.
* 🤝 Referral Program: Earn bonuses for referring talented professionals.


*At* 
***Agile Content***
*, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds and identities to apply! 🌈*

title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
Please note that we are
 *not* 
 currently accepting resumes or additional support from talent agencies or third-party sources. Any resumes received from these sources will be considered unsolicited.
   

  

 We value integrity and clear communication with our partners, and appreciate your understanding in this matter.
   

  

**The Role, At a Glance**
 We are seeking a Product Verification Engineer to evaluate software, firmware, associated with
   

  

 electronic devices to ensure exceptional product quality. This role involves comprehensive
   

  

 testing and validation of applications and associated audio/visual and room control equipment to
   

  

 meet rigorous quality standards.
   

  

**How You'll Contribute**
* Design, develop, and execute comprehensive test plans for software, firmware, associated with electronic devices
* Perform manual and automated testing including black box testing on desktop devices, networked systems, and cloud-connected devices
* Develop and maintain automated test scripts using programming languages such as C, C++, C#, Python, or similar tools
* Configure and manage network environments for testing both locally and in cloud environments
* Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams including development, quality assurance, and product management
* Analyze test results, identify defects, and work with development teams to resolve issues
* Document test plans, test cases, and results using tools such as Jira
* Review technical specifications and provide constructive feedback
* Support continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies
* Other duties as assigned


**A Successful Candidate Should Have**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering Technology, or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Minimum 6 years of hands-on testing experience with knowledge of diverse testing methodologies and protocols
* Demonstrated experience in product verification and validation processes
* Demonstrated experience with test automation tools
* Proficiency in programming languages: C, C++, C#, Python, or similar languages
* Experience with multiple operating systems: Windows, Linux, Android, iOS
* Strong understanding of network protocols and cloud technologies
* Experience with test management tools (Jira preferred)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to create detailed technical documentation including test plans and quality reports
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities


**Some Nice-to-haves**
* Experience with Dart and Flutter
* Experience with automation frameworks and tools such as pytest, Selenium, Test Complete, Playwright, Postman, or other API testing tools
* Knowledge of audio/visual equipment testing
* Experience with continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) processes
* Familiarity with industry standards and compliance requirements


**Work Environment**
* Office environment with occasional lab testing
* Ability to lift to 15 kg
* On-site presence required


**Who is Biamp?**
 We make the world’s most extraordinary audio and video solutions. For over 40 years, Biamp has created and innovated professional audiovisual solutions that enable great communication. From the smallest of rooms to the largest of venues, we empower true human connection in every space.
   

  

 As we grow to meet our customers’ needs and evolve to address the challenges of tomorrow, one guiding principle remains the same: Biamp connects people through extraordinary audiovisual experiences.
   

  

**About Our Company**
 At Biamp, we believe the employment relationship should be reciprocal. We want you to love your job, and we want your expertise and knowledge to help drive our business forward. We champion a supportive and dynamic environment filled with passionate people who choose continuous improvement over perfection. We insist on clear, explicit decision making, believe in taking calculated risks, and celebrate tough decisions even when they don’t succeed. We look for people who desire the best from themselves and encourage the same from their coworkers. Our commitment to one another and to the common goal is the most consistent reliable path to recurring success for all of us.

title: Mulesoft Integration Developer
description:
At
 **Schibsted** 
 , we empower millions of people across the Nordics to make informed decisions through trusted journalism and digital services. Behind the scenes, our
 **Integration Solutions team** 
 builds and runs the integration platform that connects our core business systems.
   

  

 We are now strengthening our team with an
 **Integration Developer with strong MuleSoft Anypoint experience** 
 , who wants to work long-term with a shared integration platform and help shape how integrations are built at scale.
   

  

**Why this role is interesting**
 This is
 **not a project-based consulting role** 
 .
   

  

 You will join our
 **Integration Competency Center (ICC)** 
 – a central team responsible for the integration platform used across HR, Finance, Payroll and other business-critical domains.
   

  

**Here, you will**
* Work with core systems and long-lived integrations
* Have real influence on platform standards, patterns and tooling
* Collaborate closely with Architects and Infrastructure team
* Help evolve a future-ready integration landscape


**What you will do**
 As an Integration Developer, you will:
   

  

* Design, develop and operate scalable and secure integrations on the MuleSoft Anypoint Platform
* Work with API-led and event-driven integration patterns
* Take shared responsibility for platform stability, monitoring and incident handling
* Collaborate with architects to continuously improve our integration standards
* Work closely with infrastructure colleagues on runtime, environments and automation
* Contribute to an agile, transparent team, sharing responsibilities and ownership


**Who you are**
 You enjoy working with integrations that matter and taking ownership beyond pure development.
   

  

 You:
   

  

* Have solid hands-on experience with MuleSoft Anypoint Platform
* Are comfortable driving integrations from concept to production
* Care about quality, scalability and maintainability
* Can explain technical solutions clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Value collaboration, trust and continuous improvement
* Appreciate autonomy and responsibility rather than micromanagement


**What you bring**
* Experience designing and building enterprise integrations (MuleSoft, APIs, messaging)
* Understanding of integration patterns and distributed systems
* Interest in platform thinking and long-term ownership
* Experience with CI/CD or infrastructure-as-code (e.g. GitHub Actions, Terraform) is a plus – but not required


**What we offer**
* A long-term in-house role with real ownership of the integration platform
* The opportunity to contribute in shaping our Integration Competency Center
* Focus on business-critical systems with a long-term, sustainable approach
* A collaborative, Nordic work culture built on trust and autonomy
* Hybrid work setup and strong focus on work-life balance


**Interested in building integrations that truly matter at scale? We’d love to hear from you!**

title: Application Engineer — Wireless Protocol (3GPP)
description:
**Overview**
 Keysight is at the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Learn more about what we do.
   

  

 Our award-winning culture embraces a bold vision of where technology can take us and a passion for tackling challenging problems with industry-first solutions. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers.
   

  

 Keysight is hiring an expert-level Application Engineer with deep 3GPP LTE/NR protocol expertise to help customers modernize and scale their wireless validation workflows. In this role, you will partner closely with customer engineering teams to understand how they validate and release features today—then propose and implement solution approaches using Keysight’s portfolio to improve
 **coverage, repeatability, and time-to-insight** 
 .
   

  

 You will operate at the intersection of standards knowledge, real-world protocol implementations, and test workflow design—translating technical goals into practical validation architectures, automation-ready execution models, and clear technical recommendations.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Lead discovery with customer engineering teams to map end-to-end protocol validation workflows: objectives, artifacts, gating criteria, toolchain integration points, and pain points.
* Translate customer goals into solution proposals using Keysight capabilities (test strategy, configuration approach, automation architecture, reporting/KPI frameworks, and scaling model).
* Define success metrics and acceptance criteria that align with customer release processes (coverage targets, regression time, reproducibility, traceability).
* Design and deliver customer-facing technical assets including PoCs, demos, workshops, and enablement sessions tailored to real engineering workflows—not generic feature tours.
* Produce reusable packages (templates, reference configurations, automation starters, reporting baselines) that accelerate adoption and reduce rework across teams and sites.
* Guide customers on standards-driven validation coverage for LTE & NR across key feature areas (e.g., SA procedures, mobility, RRM behaviors, feature interactions across releases), with strong grounding in protocol layering and call flows.
* Recommend efficient execution models (smoke → nightly → full regression), including what to run, when to run it, and how to interpret results consistently across releases.
* Collaborate with Keysight product and R&D teams to turn field learnings into portfolio improvements (diagnostic usability, coverage, workflow integration).


**Technical focus areas**
* LTE/NR procedures and call flows with strong L2/L3 grounding (RRC/PDCP/RLC/MAC concepts and interactions).
* Validation workflow design: coverage planning, regression strategy, execution scaling, and evidence-quality reporting.
* Trace/log interpretation and KPI/counter reasoning to support decision-making and workflow tuning (e.g., establishing baselines, defining pass/fail signals).
* Automation and reproducible execution (often Python-based), including integration into customer toolchains.


**Qualifications**
* Deep hands-on expertise in 3GPP LTE and/or NR with the ability to reason across procedures, releases, and real-system behavior.
* Proven experience in external-facing technical roles (application engineering, systems/integration, validation leadership, or senior R&D with customer/partner ownership).
* Strong capability to structure ambiguous requirements into a practical workflow and solution plan (test strategy + execution model + evidence/reporting).
* Practical software development skills (typically Python) to build automation, templates, and reusable tooling.
* Comfortable working in Windows and Linux-based environments.
* Strong technical communication in English and local language; able to lead workshops and align stakeholders.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with structured validation workflows (conformance-like approaches, interoperability validation, certification-oriented gating).
* Familiarity with multi-vendor integration and modern RAN architectures.
* Experience collaborating across globally distributed engineering teams.
* Exposure to 3GPP standards work, or strong experience implementing/validating features directly from evolving specs.

title: Utvecklare till försvarsindustrin
description:
Vill du vara en del av en stor teamleverans till en av HiQs största kunder och samtidigt bidra till ett säkrare samhälle?
   

  

 Vi söker nu dig som är ingenjör som har djup förståelse för teknik och några års arbetslivserfarenhet. I den här rollen kommer du ingå i ett team med erfarna kollegor som alla har hög kompetens inom området. Teamet arbetar i en javabaserad miljö med bland annat utveckling, script, testautomatisering och DevOps.
   

  

 För att trivas hos oss och i rollen tror vi att du som person är flexibel, du räds inte för att göra det som behövs och har förmåga att både samarbeta med andra och arbeta självständigt. Det faller dig naturligt att leverera resultat med hög kvalitet och att lösa kundens problem är din högsta prioritet.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Högskole-/Civilingenjörsexamen inom datateknik, teknisk fysik, elektroteknik eller motsvarande.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling inom Java eller C#.
* Erfarenhet inom testautomatisering, DevOps, felsökning och konfigurering.
* Då arbetet kan omfattas av sekretess krävs svenskt medborgarskap och att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.
* Möjlighet att jobba på plats på kontoret 3-5 dagar i veckan


**Varför HiQ**
 Sedan 1995 har HiQ varit konsultbolaget som förenklat världen för både kunder och slutanvändare med hjälp av teknik, design och kommunikation. HiQ har alltid fokuserat på två saker: att ha kul på jobbet och att leverera lösningar utöver förväntningar - det är vad som driver oss framåt! Vi HiQare är stolta över att ha en kultur som präglas av
 **resultat** 
 ,
 **ansvar, enkelhet** 
 och
 **glädje** 
 . Vi tror på att arbeta tillsammans för att nå våra gemensamma mål och strävar efter att hjälpa varandra att fortsätta växa och utvecklas. Hos oss får du utöver chansen att utveckla din egen kompetens också möjlighet att lära, leda och inspirera dina kollegor.
   

  

*I denna rekrytering tillämpar vi löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden har gått ut. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!*

description:
